Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bold cherry and berry flavors are shaded by light earthy, leathery accents in this full-bodied, ripe and lip-smacking wine. Light tannins and vibrant acidity give it plenty of lift on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rubino Estates Winery 2017 Night Owl Estate Grown Barbera (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Clements Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Smooth and flavorful, this full-bodied, single-vineyard wine feels elegant on the palate, braced by the varietal's typical tangy acidity. It offers an attractive cherry flavor accented by light oak spices.                      Jim Gordon
Name: LangeTwins 2018 Macotera 09 Vineyard Barbera (Clements Hills)

Description: While full bodied, this wine is nicely balanced and elegant in texture, smooth and warmly fruity, offering rich plums and cherries accented by maple and vanilla on silky tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oak Farm 2018 Barbera (Lodi)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine smells like fresh raspberries and red cherries and tastes vivid and bright like black cherries. Tangy acidity and a touch of balsamic keep it a bit tart on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Blue Victorian Winery 2017 Barbera (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This variety is an extreme rarity in the state let alone in the valley, though this producer has been making it for more than 20 years. The fruit-forward notes of cherry, dark raspberry and bramble capture the attention. Bright, tart, acidity-driven flavors deliver. It's thoroughly delightful. Pizza anyone?                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Woodward Canyon 2018 Estate Barbera (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With a fruity nose of blackberry and black licorice, this light, refined and food-friendly wine is textured dust and sage. Vibrant acidity keeps it lively and lengthy. It was made from organically grown grapes.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Preston 2018 Barbera (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine goes deep and wide, offering concentrated and fairly complex flavors carried on a more generous texture than usual. It is packed with red and black cherries, some ripe plums and subtle cinnamon and tamarind flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella Grace 2018 Barbera (Amador County)

Description: Earthy and savory, this juicy red opens with aromas of ripe Marasca cherry, truffle, tilled earth and blue flower. The smooth, succulent palate doles out ripe red cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and white pepper framed in supple tannins. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Anselma Giacomo 2018  Barbera d'Alba

Description: Ripe and concentrated, this has a subtle nose that eventually reveals mature black-skinned fruit, toasted nut and cooking-spice aromas. On the densely concentrated palate, polished tannins gently support fleshy black cherry, ripe plum and white pepper.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ettore Germano 2017 della Madre  (Barbera d'Alba)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a versatile, well-balanced wine that will pair with a wide variety of foods. It's rather trim in texture, lightly tannic and backed by good acidity supporting sour-cherry and black-cherry flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sobon Estate 2018 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Earthy aromas and tempting prosciutto flavors give an unusual spin to this nicely mouthfilling and creamy-textured wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mia Nipote Winery 2018 Sparkling Barbera (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Bright cherry and raspberry aromas are followed by a deeper red-fruit character on the palate, and bolstered by lively acidity for a fresh, tangy texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: William Gunn 2016 Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This beautifully concentrated, layered and velvet-textured wine is hard to resist. It packs in plenty of red- and black-cherry and pomegranate flavors, rounding them with moderate, well-integrated tannins for a luxurious mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Andis 2018 Estate Grown Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An enticing blend of vivid red- and black-cherry flavors are lifted by mild acidity and moderate tannins in this full-bodied wine. Rich nuances of cinnamon, vanilla and allspice round out the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scott Harvey 2018 J&S Reserve Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This lush yet vibrant wine is saturated with red- and black-cherry flavors and is nicely accented by chocolate and baking spices. It's full in feel, a little tangy in texture and especially appealing due to its expansive fruitiness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scott Harvey 2018 Mountain Selection Barbera (Amador County)

Description: Effusively fruity and flavorful, this full-bodied but agile wine offers amazing brightness in its cherry and raspberry flavors and has a lively texture to support them.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Andretti 2018 Barbera (California)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Complex and spicy, this medium-bodied wine is elegant and well balanced, offering tasty raspberry and red-cherry flavors accented by cedar, balsam and mint.                      Jim Gordon
Name: La Folia Winery 2017 Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Lively, juicy, fruit flavors and tingly acidity make this raspberry and red-cherry-scented “natural” wine especially vibrant. Made with no added sulfites, it's bursting with fruit flavor and uninhibited by noticeable oak or heavy tannin.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Omen 2019 Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Here ripe blackberry fruit is accented with scents and flavors of freshly cut tobacco, along with spices such as cardamom and cumin. The tannins are in the background, and add a touch of chicory and coffee to the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Naumes 2017 Barbera (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Well-balanced, fresh and appealing, this wine offers vivid red-cherry and cranberry flavors, mild tannins and a lively, crisp texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Crystal Basin Cellars 2017 Barbera (El Dorado)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Strong aromas and flavors of grilled beef and woodsmoke make this full-bodied wine rather one-dimensional, but it may please those who love toasted oak flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Iron Hub 2017 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A deft touch of new oak and sumptuous, concentrated blueberry and black-cherry flavors are delicious and impressive in this full-bodied wine. It is big and superexpressive, layering cinnamon and nutmeg over the dramatic, ripe fruit notes framed by moderate fine-grained tannins. Best through 2028.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Portalupi 2018 Shake Ridge Ranch Barbera (Amador County)

Description: This tiny production wine is made from some of the oldest Barbera in Napa Valley, planted more than 80 years ago. Tangy red fruit leads to flavors of just-picked blackberry, with bright acidity carrying the experience to an earthy mushroom finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Biale 2018 Gaudi Carli Vineyard Barbera (Calistoga)

Description: Enticing aromas of mature black-skinned berry, violet, new leather and graphite emerge from the glass. The powerful, concentrated palate offers blackberry jam, ripe black cherry and black pepper alongside fine-grained, enveloping tannins. The rich fruit flavors counterbalance the warmth of alcohol. Enjoy through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Braida di Giacomo Bologna 2017 Bricco dell'Uccellone  (Barbera d'Asti)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Incredible, effusive and concentrated fruit aromas leap from the glass in this full-bodied, generous and focused wine grown at 2,300 feet. It pours out black cherry, tart cherry and blackberry fruit, framing them nicely in moderate tannins and good acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: E16 2018 Baby Rattlesnake Vineyard Barbera (El Dorado)

Description: This opens with mature black plum, cooking spice, toasted oak and underbrush aromas. The bold, full-bodied palate offers raspberry jam, cherry marinated in spirits, vanilla and tobacco alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Braida di Giacomo Bologna 2016 Ai Suma  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, scorched earth and baking spice emerge from the glass. The full-bodied, concentrated palate offers Marasca cherry, ripe black plum, black pepper and star anise. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Braida di Giacomo Bologna 2017 Bricco della Bigotta  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Aromas of violet, black cherry and underbrush lead the way. The big, savory palate offers blackberry jam, tobacco and licorice alongside tightly knit, polished tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Braida di Giacomo Bologna 2017 Monte Bruna  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Rustic aromas of dried herbs, light mint, clove and dried berry show on the nose of this bottling. Hearty flavors of baked berry, wet rocks and chocolate arise on the palate alongside the remnant clove and herb elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Europa Village 2017 Vienza Barbera (California)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Reduced at first, this full-bodied wine brings on powerful black-cherry and sour-cherry flavors backed by firm tannins and lively acidity. It's a palate-cleansing wine that will pair well with the richest roasts and risottos.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Portalupi 2018 Shake Ridge Ranch Barbera (Amador County)

Description: Aromas of violet, baking spice and red-skinned berry lift out of the glass. The juicy palate offers red cherry, raspberry jam and tobacco alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Castlet 2016 Litina  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: Enticing aromas of black cherry, eucalyptus and tobacco lead the way. The savory, full-bodied palate delivers crushed blackberry, clove and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vite Colte 2016 La Luna e i Falò  (Nizza)

Description: Aromas of red-skinned berry, cooking spice and green peppercorn lead the way. The silky palate offers fleshy black cherry, almond and licorice alongside fresh acidity and pliant tannins. Enjoy through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Damilano 2018  Barbera d'Asti

Description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, forest floor and underbrush form the earthy, alluring nose. The savory, approachable palate offers ripe black plum, tobacco and black pepper alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pico Maccario 2017 Tre Roveri  (Nizza)

Description: Aromas of black plum, tilled soil and baking spice lead the way. The savory, rich palate offers blackberry jam, tobacco and licorice alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tre Secoli 2016 Riserva  (Nizza)

Description: Aromas of black cherry, cedar and baking spice are front and center. The savory, medium-bodied palate offers crushed blackberry, tobacco and a hint of orange zest alongside lithe tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Enrico Serafino 2017 Cruva  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, scorched earth and mocha lead the nose. The concentrated palate offers blackberry jam, vanilla and tobacco alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Garesio 2017  Nizza

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and eucalyptus emerge from the glass. The concentrated palate shows black currant, clove and mocha alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pico Maccario 2017 Epico  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, cedar and cooking spice emerge from the glass. The concentrated palate offers blackberry jam, clove and licorice alongside firm tannins. Enjoy through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vite Colte 2017 La Luna e i Falò  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: Violet, red-plum and baking-spice aromas emerge from the glass. The juicy palate offers raspberry jam, black cherry and star anise alongside pliant tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marenco 2018 Bassina  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, cedar and tobacco. On the dense palate, pliant tannins accompany blackberry jam, mocha and clove notes alongside the warmth of evident alcohol. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Castlet 2016 Passum  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A savory, earthy expression of bay leaves and grape stems gives this medium- to full-bodied wine an interesting twist while plummy flavors, good acidity and light tannins balance it out well.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Portalupi 2018 Pauli Ranch Barbera (Mendocino County)

Description: Aromas of black plum, underbrush and mocha form the nose. The juicy, approachable palate offers Marasca cherry, clove and white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vinchio-Vaglio Serra 2015 Laudana  (Nizza)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals ripe black plum, smoke and scorched earth. The dense palate offers prune, mocha and vanilla alongside dusty tannins. You'll also detect the warmth of evident alcohol on the close. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Botolo 2016  Nizza

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, baking spice and clove emerge from the glass. The juicy palate offers crushed blackberry, star anise and a hint of white pepper alongside easygoing tannins and fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vinchio-Vaglio Serra 2018 Sorì dei Mori  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Subtle red-skinned berry and baking-spice aromas emerge from the glass. The straightforward palate offers raspberry, clove and white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Viotti 2016 Ca' Nova  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Aromas of violet, underbrush and cooking spice emerge from the glass. The savory palate offers black cherry, raspberry jam and star anise alongside smooth tannins and bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pico Maccario 2018 Lavignone  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this offers red-skinned berry, underbrush and cake-spice aromas. The easy-drinking palate features raspberry jam, star anise and cinnamon alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Crotin 2018 La Martina  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This opens with dark-skinned berry and cooking-spice aromas. The easy-drinking palate offers ripe blackberry, clove and a hint of white pepper alongside round tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Abbazia 2018  Barbera d'Asti

Description: Violet, black-skinned berry and cedar aromas come together in the glass. The savory palate doles out blackberry, clove and ground pepper alongside firm acidity and pliant tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello del Poggio 2018  Barbera d'Asti

Description: Aromas of cedar, mocha and black plum lead the nose. The dense palate offers blackberry jam, toasted oak and licorice alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta San Mauro 2016  Barbera d'Asti Superiore

Description: This opens with aromas of black-skinned berry and whiffs of dark spice. The straightforward palate offers black plum, almond and ground clove alongside supple tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vinchio-Vaglio Serra 2017 I Tre Vescovi  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Aromas of violet, underbrush and clove lead the nose. The savory, easygoing palate offers red cherry, cinnamon and white pepper alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Castlet 2018  Barbera d'Asti

Description: This has aromas suggesting red plum, underbrush and baking spice. The juicy, accessible palate offers raspberry jam, white pepper and star anise alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Dogliotti 1870 2018  Barbera d'Asti

Description: Espresso, ripe black-plum and scorched earth aromas form the subtle nose on this solid red. The dense, monolithic palate offers toasted oak, prune and roasted coffee bean alongside ripe tannins and the heat of evident, almost scorching alcohol. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Falchetto 2015 Bricco Rocche Riserva  (Nizza)

Description: Made with organically grown Barbera grapes, this features aromas of red-skinned berry, scorched earth and baking spice. The straightforward palate offers red cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tre Secoli 2018 Larame  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This opens with aromas of black plum, cedar and espresso. The dense palate offers black-currant jam, coconut and black pepper alongside dusty tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: CarlindePaolo 2016 Bricco della Cappelletta  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This opens with aromas of vanilla, violet and baking spice. The no-frills, accessible palate offers blackberry jam, almond and star anise alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Olim Bauda 2018  Barbera d'Asti

Description: This opens with aromas of mocha, dried plum and clove. The warm, straightforward palate offers raisin, cedar and vanilla alongside round tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Botolo 2016  Barbera d'Asti Superiore

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of red-skinned fruit and cooking spice. The simple palate offers red cherry, star anise and vanilla alongside rounded tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Botolo 2018  Barbera d'Asti

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of red-skinned fruit and cooking spice. The simple palate offers red cherry, star anise and vanilla alongside rounded tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Botolo 2018  Barbera d'Asti

Description: Subdued aromas evoking cedar, baking spice and mocha slowly emerge from the glass. The straightforward, approachable palate suggests baked plum, clove and vanilla alongside rounded tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Neirano 2018 Le Croci  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This has aromas of black-skinned fruit, scorched soil and baking spice. The ripe, brawny palate offers prune and licorice alongside rounded tannins before closing on the heat of evident alcohol.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bricco dei Guazzi 2017  Barbera d'Asti

Description: Earthy aromas of scorched earth, dark-skinned berry and leather lead the nose. The straightforward, accessible palate offers blackberry jam, vanilla and star anise alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca' de Lion Ghione 2017 Le Muccie  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: Toasted oak, vanilla and scorched earth lead the way while the dense, syrupy palate evokes prune, mocha and coconut alongside assertive tannins. The scorching heat of evident alcohol dominates the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Falchetto 2017 Bricco Paradiso  (Barbera d'Asti)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Beefy, meaty, toasted-oak and black-pepper flavors dominate this heavily spiced and full-bodied wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Vina Moda 2018 Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Description: This simple red opens with aromas suggesting red-skinned berry and baking spice. The easy-drinking palate offers raspberry and a hint of clove alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Giordano 2018 Collection  (Barbera d'Asti)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Aromatics of cinnamon and cedar lead to an opulent and relaxed expression of blackberries and black currants in this firm but well-rounded wine. It's almost mature but will drink well through 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wild Diamond 2014 Homme Barbera (Lake County)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: The Italian varieties seem to excel in Temecula, and this Barbera makes for a great table wine to serve with a wide array of foods, from pizza to barbecue. Aromas of cola, rust, baked cherry and fennel lead unto a palate that mixes French toast spices with baked strawberry and ample acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Europa Village 2016 Vienza Barbera (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and well-balanced wine from a little-known and very consistent producer is smooth as velvet and well-saturated with ripe plum, red beet and a hint of chocolate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oakstone 2018 Naylor Vineyard Barbera (Fair Play)

Description: Earthy, savory herbs and spices and mealy oak dominate the nose of this Coonawarra Barbera, although red and purple fruit along with violet notes make it to the surface, too. The palate is more harmonious. Medium to full bodied, a grip of tannins is tempered by juicy fruit, fresh acidity and a herb-flecked finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Hollick 2018 The Gondolier Barbera (Coonawarra)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine shows some richness in the black-fruit flavors and in the texture, too, but also firms up nicely due to moderate tannins. It is not superexpressive but is well-balanced.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wild Diamond 2014 Femme Barbera (Lake County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine is playing its cards close to the vest, not revealing much in the aromas and flavors until the finish, but showing a firm, moderately tannic structure.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wild Diamond 2015 Barbera (Lake County)

Appellation: Alta Mesa, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Light herb and dusty earth aromas are backed by tangy red-fruit flavors and light tannins. This medium-bodied wine is lighter than many big reds.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wise Villa 2018 Barbera (Alta Mesa)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Bright red-cherry flavors mingle with black plums in this full-bodied and moderately tannic wine. It has a firm texture and holds is flavors tightly.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Solitary Cellars 2018 Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: Vinous aromas of just-pressed grapes, fragrant blue flower and mature blueberry form the inviting nose along with whiffs of graphite and underbrush. Chewy and delicious, the smooth, concentrated palate doles out succulent black cherry, crushed blackberry, star anise and a hint of game alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2017 Cipressi  (Nizza)

Appellation: Barbera d'Asti Superiore Nizza, Piedmont, Italy
Description: Earthy aromas of ripe black cherry, porcini mushroom, menthol, game and moist just-tilled soil slowly make their way to the forefront. The aromas carry over to the chewy concentrated palate along with a hint of tobacco while buffed tannins provide smooth support. It's savory and already accessible. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2013 La Court Vigna Veja  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore Nizza)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a bold, bright wine that packs plenty of fresh blackberry and black-plum flavors that are held by moderate tannins for a good, appetizing grip. Concentrated fruit flavors and subtle vanilla, nutmeg and clove accents add to its appeal.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terra d'Oro 2018 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Mouthfilling and plush in feel, this mellow yet complex wine offers mulled fruit flavors, a hint of ragù and subtle accents of earth and tobacco. It's extremely smooth, offering light tannins and subdued acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap 2018 Barbera (El Dorado)

Description: Aromas of forest floor, dark-skinned berry and cooking spice form the nose. The full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, clove and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Olim Bauda 2016 Riserva  (Nizza)

Description: Dense and chewy, this full-bodied wine is nicely laced with firm tannins that support bold black-fruit flavors and hints of baking spices.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Prima Materia 2017 Barbera

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, cooking spice and underbrush emerge from the glass. The juicy palate offers blackberry jam, orange zest and white pepper alongside polished tannins and bright acidity. Enjoy through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Montemagno 2017 Austerum  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, mocha and tilled soil. The brawny concentrated palate offers ripe blackberry, roasted coffee bean and star anise alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gianni Doglia 2017 Viti Vecchie  (Nizza)

Description: Violet, black-skinned berry and eucalyptus aromas emerge from the glass. The juicy palate shows blackberry jam, clove and white pepper alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gianni Doglia 2018 Bosco Donne  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of scorched earth, mature black plum and baking spice. The ripe palate offers clove, espresso and blackberry jam alongside pliant tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tre Secoli 2015  Nizza

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, charred underbrush and dark-skinned fruit form the nose. The ripe palate offers blackberry jam, vanilla and mocha alongside rounded tannins. Enjoy through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Garesio 2016 Riserva  (Nizza)

Description: Ripe dark-skinned fruit, cedar and mocha aromas emerge from the glass. The firm palate offers blackberry jam, vanilla and clove alongside grainy tannins. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tre Secoli 2015 Sorangela  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Subtle aromas of dark-skinned berry and baking spice emerge from the glass. The enjoyable, easy-drinking palate offers red cherry, green peppercorn and star anise alongside pliant tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: CarlindePaolo 2018 Ad Libitum  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: Aromas of coconut, cedar and black plum emerge from the glass. The firm palate offers prune, clove and tobacco alongside chewy tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Guido Vada 2016 Cà del Mura  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of smoke, dark-skinned berry and cedar. The solid palate offers blackberry jam, mocha and clove alongside forward tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Cascinone 2016 Rive  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Delicate aromas of dark-skinned fruit, scorched earth and baking spice emerge from the glass. The concentrated palate suggests ripe black plum, star anise and clove alongside smooth tannins and the heat of evident alcohol. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franco Roero 2017 Carbunè  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned fruit, cedar and cooking spice come together in the glass. The chewy palate offers blackberry jam, coconut and black pepper alongside pliant tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Araldica 2017 Campo del Senatore  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: Aromas of scorched earth, cedar and dark-skinned fruit lead the nose. The ripe forward palate offers mature black cherry, licorice and black pepper alongside supple tannins. Enjoy through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gianni Doglia 2017 Genio  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This opens with black-skinned berry and forest-floor aromas. The medium-bodied, straightforward palate offers black cherry, nutmeg and white pepper alongside pliant tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: San Silvestro 2017  Barbera d'Asti Superiore

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, cooking spice and clove emerge from the glass. The easygoing palate offers blackberry jam, star anise and white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Araldica 2016 Albera  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This opens with red-skinned berry, underbrush and ground clove aromas. The straightforward palate offers cassis, orange zest and white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Guido Vada 2017 Tanguera  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals suggestions of dark-skinned fruit and cooking spice. The ripe dense palate is dominated by evident alcohol and offers prune, roasted coffee bean and coconut alongside smooth tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franco Roero 2016 Sichei  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This has aromas of violet, black-skinned fruit and cooking spice. The easy-drinking palate offers blackberry jam and licorice alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Cascinone 2017 Crocera  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This straightforward red has delicate aromas suggesting red-skinned fruit and cooking spice. The easygoing palate offers red plum and tobacco alongside relaxed tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: CarlindePaolo 2018 Cursus Vitae  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals toasted oak, tilled soil and mocha. The dense palate offers prune, espresso and clove alongside ripe tannins and the heat of evident alcohol. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Olim Bauda 2016 Le Rocchette  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Black raspberry, roasted fennel bulb and a hint of light clove appear on the nose of this bottling, which shows strong promise for this Southern California region. There is a strong peppery spice to the palate, where rose petals, roasted strawberries and charred cherries ride strong acid into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: 2 Plank 2016 Barbera (San Diego County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Aromas of plum, asphalt, mineral and dried herb lead to medium-bodied, fruitful cranberry and raspberry flavors, with a tangy warm finish. The acidity keeps the interest up, though the warmth is a bit distracting.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Catman 2018 Reserve Barbera (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Cienega Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Leather, cigar, prune, raisin, fig and a fresh splash of blackberry show on the heady and dynamic nose of this Port-inspired bottling. Black-currant-jam flavor hits the palate first, followed by truffle, cocoa and coffee. Ample acidity and tannins carry the experience on for minutes.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Roxo Cellars 2013 Barbera (Cienega Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine offers rich, palate-coating fruit and dark-spice flavors that sit on a mouthfilling, velvety texture. Good depth and a sense of layering add to its considerable appeal.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Andis 2017 d'Amador Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine is aromatic and smooth. Cedar and floral aromas lead to focused, mulled fruit flavors and a silky texture that shows light tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scott Harvey 2017 J&S Reserve Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas intrigue, with notes of smoke, cedar, dried tobacco and red cherry. A light, elegant palate follows, with a pleasing, juicy feel. The transparency is enchanting.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: College Cellars 2017 Anderson Vineyard Barbera (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Both bold and lively, this full-bodied wine grips ripe red cherry and raspberry with some good acidity and mild tannins. Enticing aromas of cedar and toast last through the palate impression and finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scott Harvey 2017 Mountain Selection Barbera (Amador County)

Description: Aromas of red apple and raspberry are accented by notes of holly. Tart berry acidity and mild, powdery tannins form the structure on that palate that blends cranberry and raspberry flavors with earthy clove. Easy and approachable, the finish lingers on lingonberry and pepper.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Restoration 2017 Barbera (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This light-bodied wine shows off the vibrant side of the grape variety and nicely balances its acidity with berry flavors and subtle oak spices.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Noceto 2016 Linstead Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A commendable effort to craft the highly acidic Barbera grape into a sparkling red wine, however this doesn't quite hit the mark. Juicy dark cherry and bramble berry tones are accented by a bit of black currant leaf, yet the foamy palate detracts from these flavors, and the finish is dominated by bitter tannins.                      Alexander Peartree
Designation: Pilot Series Fortune Favors the Bold Methodé Champenoise
Name: Three Brothers 2017 Pilot Series Fortune Favors the Bold Methodé Champenoise Barbera (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Full bodied and full flavored, this big generous wine overflows with attractive berry and oak flavors that coat the mouth and linger on the finish. The texture is moderately tannic and nicely supports all the richness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Amador Cellars 2017 Fields Family Vineyard Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: Of the “alternative” red varieties in this producer's saddlebag, this cherry-hued Barbera wins the prize for funkiest. Reductive on the nose, notes of damp earth and mushrooms are present but don't overpower the ripe, almost raisined, cherry and blueberry fruit. Forrest floor aromas emerge with swirling in glass. Rich and mouthcoating, tannins are earthy and drying, the fruit heavyset but with an appealing tang. Finishes with a prickle of spice.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Alpha Box & Dice 2017 Enigma Barbera (Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Spicy, chocolaty and complex, this luxurious wine is drenched in blackberries, cocoa and vanilla. Oaky baking spices dominate the flavors but in a good way.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Langman Estate 2016 Vincent Henry's Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This polished and ripe-tasting wine has smoothed all the tart edges of the grape variety for an easy-sipping, fruit and spice approach.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Belledor 2017 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried strawberry aromas meet with stone, leather, fruit punch and red spices of sumac and cinnamon on the dynamic, delicious nose of this bottling. It's fresh and soft on the palate, where flavors range from roasted pork in cranberry sauce to licorice and light wood.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lepiane 2016 Walker Vineyard Barbera (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and dark aromas of ripe blackberries, fresh raspberries and smashed red currants meet with inviting hints of clove on the nose of this bottling. The cohesive palate combines dark red fruit and baking spice with ample amounts of acid.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rincon Mountain 2017 Estate Barbera (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tangy aromas of cherry and raspberry are lifted by white pepper on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows dried raspberry, leather and aged meats, with some age already apparent.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lepiane 2017 Walker Vineyard Barbera (Los Olivos District)

Description: Spicy cinnamon and black pepper open the way for a plummy, fruity midpalate of robust ripeness and texture in this classic wine, fresh in underlying acidity. The oak is toasted and prominent giving it additional weight and a fleshy aspect that appeals.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Seghesio 2017 Barbera (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Generous cherry aromas and flavors are nicely balanced by fruit acidity and light tannins in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It tastes fresh, vibrant and polished.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Las Positas 2016 Estate Barbera (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Soft, smooth and uncomplicated, this fruity, juicy, fresh-tasting wine is easy to sip and appreciate. Blackberry and raspberry flavors are buoyed by a bit of acidity for good balance despite elevated alcohol.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Shooting Star 2017 Barbera (Lake County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lavish oaky, smoky spices dominate this full-bodied, moderately tannic wine, laying flavors of cedar, clove and cinnamon over a moderate black-fruit core. It's big and flashy.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Las Positas 2016 Estate Reserve Barbera (Livermore Valley)

Description: Beefy, smoky, oaky aromas and flavors nearly smother the fruit flavors in this full-bodied and firm-textured wine. All that showy oak tilts the balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oak Farm 2017 Barbera (Lodi)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright aromas of ripe berry, lavender, cinnamon stick and clove kick off the nose on this bottling. That fruit and spice mix is strong on the palate as well, alongside clove and more mulling spices.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Alara 2017 Barbera (San Benito County)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark red plums, fragrant herbs and crumpled flower petals show on the nose of this bottling by Steve Clifton. Tangy black-plum flavors are enhanced by oregano and pepper dust on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Palmina 2015 Walker Vineyard Barbera (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A pale yellowish-pink in color, this rosé begins with aromas of light melon, citrus pith and coconut flake on the nose. It's tightly woven and brisk on the palate, which is more about texture than the lime-driven flavor.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Alara 2018 Rosé of Barbera (San Benito County)

Description: Dried berry fruit, chemical oak and vanilla aromas feed into a clipped palate with hard tannins and citric acidity. This Barbera tastes of mint, cherry and green berry fruits, while the finish is tight and snappy, with aggressive intensity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Tagua Tagua 2018 Des Complicados Barbera (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This concentrated, plush wine tames the tart nature of Barbera and brings out a vibrant but velvety texture that carries black-cherry and raspberry flavors through a lingering finish. Hints of dark chocolate and baking spices add extra complexity to this excellent offering.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Portalupi 2017 Pauli Ranch Barbera (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and delicious, this full-bodied wine offers generous, very ripe black-fruit flavors accented by dark chocolate, leather and turned earth notes. It is mouthfilling, full of soft tannins and nicely layered.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rubino Estates Winery 2016 Night Owl Estate Grown Barbera (Livermore Valley)

Description: A single-varietal Barbera is a rare find in Australia. This medium-weight Adelaide Hills expression is aromatic and likable, singing notes of tart pie cherries, savory spices and touches of floral soap and earthy, stony mineral nuances. The berry fruit on the palate feels all the more tart by the line of pristine acidity, wound by focused, supportive tannins.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Living Roots 2017 Native Currant Barbera (Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Nicely balanced and medium bodied, this lively and appetizing wine frames attractive raspberry and red-cherry flavors in tangy acidity and light tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella Grace 2017 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: San Benito, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Gamy, leathery aromas kick off the nose of this bottling, which also shows aromas of black pepper and roasted meats. The sip is also quite gamy and pepper-driven, with loads of leather and not much fruit.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bella Luna 2016 Lot One Siletto Vineyards Barbera (San Benito)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This tiny-production wine is smooth, broad and gently fruity, offering ample ripe berry and black-cherry flavors and light leather and earth accents.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Eclectic 2017 Tanner Vineyard Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Description: This oaky wine pits strong smoky aromas and flavors against rather tart raspberry flavors for a tense balance and lean mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: McManis 2018 Jamie Lynn Vineyard Estate Grown Barbera (California)

Description: Aromas of wild berry, violet and dark spice mingle with earthy notes of truffle and a hint of game. On the savory palate, bright acidity accompanies juicy morello cherry, black raspberry and star anise along with a hint of eucalyptus. Polished tannins provide lithe support.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2016 Cipressi  (Nizza)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned fruit, menthol and exotic spice shape the nose. On the taut, elegant palate, fresh acidity and velvety tannins accompany black cherry, blackberry, licorice and tobacco. It closes on a mocha note. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2016 La Court  (Nizza)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A great example of a Sierra region Barbera, this full-bodied wine overflows with ripe black-fruit and oak-spice flavors wrapped in a polished texture that makes it silky and melting on the palate. The grapes were grown at 2,300 feet and aged in French oak.                      Jim Gordon
Name: E16 2017 Baby Rattlesnake Vineyard Barbera (El Dorado)

Description: Meaty, thick and well-integrated, this is a bright, effusive red wine of Italian heritage that offers length and breadth. High-toned acidity helps to keep it fresh despite its underlying power and concentration.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Seghesio 2016 Barbera (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Exotic berry, cigar-box, roasted cherry and perfume-like potpourri aromas show on the nose of this reserve bottling from the grapes that surround the winery. There is a fresh snap to the tip of the sip, where lively acidity carries candied-cherry and peppery spices across the medium-bodied palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Robert Renzoni 2016 Riserva Barbera (Temecula Valley)

Description: Balsamic aromas of camphor mingle with new leather, French oak, blue flower and exotic spice. Densely concentrated, the brawny palate offers prune marinated in spirits, licorice, tobacco and a note of dried cherry alongside tightly knit, close-grained tannins and the heat of evident alcohol. This is all about power and spice but fans of fruit richness should drink sooner rather than later.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Coppo 2015 Riserva della Famiglia  (Nizza)

Description: Aromas of black- and red-skinned berry, blue flower and exotic spice waft out of the glass along with a whiff of graphite. On the linear palate, bright acidity accompanies juicy red cherry, ripe raspberry, green pepper corn and a hint of star anise. Polished tannins offer lithe support.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Saracco 2016 Per Sba Glio  (Barbera d'Alba)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Good ripeness and concentration make this full-bodied wine compelling to sip, while a firm structure of moderate tannins and lifted acidity frames the fruit flavors well. Think black cherry, black currant and subtle baking spices from oak aging.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap 2017 Barbera (El Dorado)

Description: Mature black-skinned fruit, leather, blue flower and exotic spice mingle with balsamic notes on this brawny red. The jammy palate shows baked plum, ripe blackberry, tobacco and oak-driven spice set against enveloping tannins and the warmth of alcohol.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Coppo 2016 Pomorosso  (Nizza)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Billowing aromas of black cherry and toffee are rich and caramelly on the nose of this bottling, which is attention-grabbing although not very reminiscent of Barbera. It's very rich on the palate with unctuous flavors of black-currant paste and elderberry jam, with coffee and milk-chocolate touches lingering into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bushong 2018 Sleep Angel Famous Author Vineyard Barbera (Paso Robles)

Description: This juicy red opens with aromas of ripe dark-skinned berry, star anise and a whiff of forest floor. Rounded, chewy and fresh, the savory palate doles out mature Marasca cherry, cranberry, licorice and a hint of truffle alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2017 Le Orme 16 Mesi  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Soft and approachable, this offers aroma of mature blackberry, forest floor and blue flower. On the savory palate, pliant tannins accompany juicy black cherry, raspberry and a pepper note. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bava 2017 Libera  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Fragrant and fresh, this has classic varietal aromas of dark-skinned berry, baking spice and blue flower. On the savory palate, bright acidity and smooth tannins accompany flavors of Marasca cherry, raspberry and white pepper. Enjoy through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi Incisa della Rocchetta 2018 Valmorena  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Underbrush, prune and dark-spice aromas shape the nose. Reflecting the aromas, it's ripe and rounded, offering flavors recalling mature blackberry, tobacco and licorice. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bersano 2015 Generala Riserva  (Nizza)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Robust and nicely oaky, this full-bodied wine offers aromas of wood smoke and grilled beef, and flavors of salt, pepper and grilled plums. Multiple savory, herbal and earthy accents all add welcome complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Iron Hub 2016 Barbera (Amador County)

Description: Racy and linear, this has enticing scents of red berry and dark spice. On the bright palate, vibrant acidity accompanies sour cherry, pomegranate and a hint of star anise. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Coppo 2018 L'Avvocata  (Barbera d'Asti)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is well-balanced, moderately fruity and has a nice bit of grip in the texture. It's smooth and firm on the palate, and the red-cherry and plum flavors are persistent.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Solitary Cellars 2017 Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is very fruity in flavor and gentle in texture. It soothes the taste buds with warm blueberry and blackberry notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella Grace 2016 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Generous aromas of black pepper, flint and wood smoke lead to light blackberry and cranberry flavors in this medium-bodied experimental wine. The makers used native yeast and Belgian beer yeast in the fermentation, and cherry, maple and hickory wood in the aging process. No sulfites were added.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lucid 2018 L.03 Manifesto Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Packed with fruit flavor and generously sprinkled with oak, this full-bodied wine feels comfortable on the palate and shows abundant ripe blackberry, fig and plum flavors. It has moderate, well-integrated tannins that support a lush mouthfeel and lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Yorba 2013 Barbera (Amador County)

Description: Violet, rose, red berry, exotic spice and a yeasty whiff of pastry dough lift out of the glass on this elegant sparkler. On the racy, savory palate, vibrant acidity accompanies tangy sour cherry, pomegranate, pastry cream and orange zest. A silky perlage provides the polished backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Montemagno 2014 TM Brut 24 Barbera (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is polished, well-rounded and packed with generous fruit flavors. A baking spice aroma leads to rich berry flavors on the palate, while abundant yet soft tannins shape the velvety mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terra d'Oro 2017 Barbera (Amador County)

Description: Prominent oak spices and generous fruit flavors combine nicely in this full-bodied and firm-textured wine. Hints of baking spices and butter mingle with nicely ripe blackberry notes that are mouthfilling.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cardella 2014 L'aquedotto Vineyard Barbera (California)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intense berry aromas and loads of fresh ripe berry flavors flood this full-bodied wine. It offers a smooth rich texture, great concentration and a touch of tannin that adds nicely to the mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Las Positas 2015 Estate Barbera (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very dark in the glass, this is a powerful bottling loaded with cassis, black plum and wood spice on the nose. The palate is fully loaded with more black-plum, blackberry and baking-spice flavors, proving quite intense.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pianetta 2017 Barbera (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rustic flavors and a velvety texture make a good combination in this full-bodied wine. Leather and farmyard aromas are followed by concentrated blackberry and raspberry flavors and a smooth but lively mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rodrigue Molyneaux 2016 Estate Grown Barbera (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Heavily oaked and full bodied, this wine is covered in woody cedary baking-spice aromas followed by tart blackberry and raspberry flavors and a firm streak of acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rubino Estates Winery 2015 Landmark Collection Barbera (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This fruity and straightforward wine shows dried herb aromas, good raspberry and plum flavors, a smooth texture and very little oak spice. It is uncomplicated and easy to drink.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oakstone 2017 Naylor Vineyard Barbera (Fair Play)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is an oak bomb from the smoky charred cedary aromas to the flavors of toasted baguette and baking spices to the rather tart and moderately tannic texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Jeff Runquist 2017 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This reserve bottling spent 17 months in 61% new French oak and leads with black fruits and tobacco. The ripe fruits easily handle the wood, layering in notes of smoke, char, coffee and vanilla. The acidity is in place to secure this as cellarable, though it won't disappoint should you drink it sooner rather than later.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: DanCin 2017 Tribute Barbera (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Though Oregon Barbera is quite rare, DanCin has released a pair of them that should dramatically elevate the interest in the grape. Almost black in color, the Onore is packed with dark fruits, notably black cherry and cassis. There are interesting aromatics also, of smoked tomato and pipe tobacco, furthering the impression that this wine successfully reflects true varietal character.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: DanCin 2017 Onore Barbera (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Hailing from Destiny Ridge Vineyards, overripe raspberry, wilted flower and rose hip aromas are followed by tart red fruit flavors. It's all a strange mix.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Skagit 2016 Destiny Ridge Vineyard Barbera (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a bursting amount of bright berries and red currants but also underlying clay and earth elements on the fascinating nose of this fresh bottling. The sip is electric, with zesty carbonic-like flavors of red berries. Drink up now while it's fresh.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Giornata 2018 Barbera (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Reticent aromas of raspberry, red plum and wet penny are followed by fuller-feeling but lighter-styled tangy flavors. It's an odd mix.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Columbia Winery 2017 Barbera (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine offers bright, concentrated black-cherry and raspberry flavors. It is built by crisp acidity and mild tannins that don't get in the way of the bold, fruity character.                      Jim Gordon
Name: E16 2016 Baby Rattlesnake Vineyard Barbera (El Dorado)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Bursting with strawberry, raspberry and red-cherry flavors, this aromatic and intensely fruity wine is a joy to taste. It feels bright and somewhat tart on the palate, tastes fresh, concentrated and well balanced.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Amador Cellars 2016 Fields Family Vineyard Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Opulent oak aromas and flavors meet bold, very ripe and somewhat tart fruit flavors in this full-bodied, ambitious wine. Aromas like graphite, cigar box and wood smoke lead to red- and black-cherry flavors that mingle but don't quite meld with the woody character. It will be interesting to see how it evolves through 2022.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rancho Victoria 2016 Reserve Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is full bodied and rather tart in flavor, showing red cherry, sour cherry and raspberry that make it tangy on the palate. Subtle oak shadings emerge on the finish as the wine reveals good depth and complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rancho Victoria 2016 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This tasty and medium-bodied wine is quite fruity, well balanced and showing just enough ripeness to feel rounded in the mouth. It has crisp acidity to buoy the ripe plums and berries.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sierra Starr 2017 Cooper Ranch Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and oak-accented wine displays vivid red- and black-cherry flavors, bright acidity and a touch of tannin for grip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Noceto 2015 Linsteadt Vineyard Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Heavy oak aromas and flavors quash the fruity notes in this lopsided, full-bodied wine. It's something only oak lovers will appreciate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Shenandoah Vineyards 2017 ReZerve Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This tiny-production estate wine is bright and juicy, offering a soft rustic underpinning of layered tannin, rounded richness and high-toned acidity. It tastes of freshly picked strawberry and cherry, with a lasting tartness that appeals.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Orsi Family 2015 Barbera (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This wine has a nose of raspberry and violet. It is bright on entry, with silky tannins and flavors of blackberry, black cherry, caramel and dark chocolate that softly fade into a drawn out finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Shiloh Winery 2017 Shor Barbera (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This well-balanced and nicely complex wine shows sophisticated, subtle wood-smoke and black-pepper aromas, good ripe black-cherry flavors shaded by hints of toast and cacao, and a very smooth but also firm texture. Moderate tannins and good acidity give it a mouth-cleansing structure.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Las Positas 2014 Estate Reserve Barbera (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fascinating cola, hard candy, cherry, plum, cedar box and freshly cut fennel aromas are followed by well-balanced fruit flavors, framed by lively acidity. It delights.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Maryhill 2016 Proprietor's Reserve Gunkel Vineyard Barbera (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine shows appealing, lightly spicy aromas, ripe and fresh fruit flavors, full body and good balance. It tastes refreshing, clean and a little bit complex due to subtle cinnamon and cedar aromas that meet fresh cherries and berries in a lightly tannic texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Steiner Family Vineyards 2016 No. 19 Barbera (Fair Play)

Appellation: Alta Mesa, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Hints of black pepper and baking spices dress up a solid core of raspberry and cherry flavors in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It has a bright fruity character, not much in terms of tannin but good acidity for an appetizing palate and finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wise Villa 2017 Barbera (Alta Mesa)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bold black-cherry aromas and bright blackberry flavors give this full-bodied wine a very fruity and sleek appeal. It feels smooth and tastes frank and straightforward.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Las Positas 2014 Estate Barbera (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine wraps its core of black cherry with a spicy coating of oak that starts in the toasty spicy aromas and continues in touches of butter and earth in the flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Steiner Family Vineyards 2016 No. 19 Cooper Ranch Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This sturdy hearty wine packs raspberry and turned earth aromas on top of ripe and tasty berry flavors. It has a smooth texture and mild tannins for easy sipping.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Risk 2017 Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The benefits of 33% new French barrels are evident in this keenly balanced and medium-bodied wine. An enticing, floral cedary aroma precedes bright and concentrated black-cherry and red-cherry flavors that bring good focus and freshness and a lively fruity finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Meikle 2016 Estate Grown Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This broad-textured and full-bodied Barbera from the heart of Zinfandel country in Amador County wraps mulled cherries and ripe raspberries in supple tannins and soft acidity for a soothing palate and finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Solitary Cellars 2016 Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Tracy Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: this full-bodied and assertive wine has vivid oaky aromas of smoked meats and charred wood that meet equally spicy, smoky beefy flavors wrapped in moderate tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dante Robere 2016 Barbera (Tracy Hills)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Smoked berries, plum and vanilla cookies show on the nose of this bottling, which is an estate-grown project packaged in a royal-themed bottling with a metallic crest. The palate blends milk chocolate with tangy red-plum and strawberry fruit, gingerbread and graham cracker touches, and evolves dynamically as it breathes.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Robert Renzoni 2015 Riserva Barbera (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From a winery that sits on the mountaintop atop the famed Rincon Point surfing break, this wine, which comes from an estate vineyard in Paso Robles, shows coffee, baked black cherries, black currant and peppercorns on the nose. The palate is loaded with plum paste, crushed slate and elderberry, wrapped in elegant tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rincon Mountain 2015 Barbera (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Ventura County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ojai's Adam Tolmach is leading the charge for a return to grape-growing here, and this bottling is an epic show of potential. Freshly smashed boysenberry and black raspberry meet with white pepper on the fresh nose. The palate is tightly wound with boysenberry, wild thyme and fennel-pollen flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ojai 2016 Rich Vineyard Barbera (Ventura County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This lavishly fruity and well-oaked wine tames the tart nature of the varietal quite well, bringing richness and warmth to the palate along with delicious red-cherry, black-plum and baking-spice nuances. Light tannins give the texture just enough grip for pairing with big proteins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Binz 2016 Sleeper-Crain Vineyard Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a rich, warm wine that blends fruit and oak elements seamlessly for a mouthfilling flavorful character. It shows light baking spices and ripe fruit in the aromas, deep cherry and berry flavors and a soothing, velvety texture backed by fine-grained tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Iron Hub 2015 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This supple, layered wine has inviting balsam and raspberry aromas, generous berry flavors and a soothing, mild texture. It is medium bodied, easy to enjoy and should pair well with a wide range of foods.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2016 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a focused, balanced and full-bodied wine. It shows nicely concentrated cherry and berry flavors, and soft accents of black pepper and cedar that add complexity. Light tannins and a supple texture complete the package.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Berryessa Gap 2016 Barbera (Yolo County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine is fresh and lively in red cherry and raspberry aromas. The palate brings tart fruit flavors and good balance. It is a vibrant and appetizing expression of the grape.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sobon Estate 2017 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: This deeply colored, concentrated and lightly tannic wine combines tart red-cherry and sour cherry aromas with darker fruit flavors and full body. The texture is smooth but tightened by acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: High Valley Vineyard 2015 Barbera (High Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A rich, plummy aroma is followed by fresh berry flavors and sugarplum accents on a smooth texture. The wine is medium bodied, fresh and fruity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Renwood 2016 Grand Reserve Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine shows dried fruit aromas, very ripe raisiny flavors, firm tannins and acidity, and a lingering tangy and tannic finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Naggiar 2016 Estate Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is deep in color, powerful in oak and fruit aromas and very focused in flavors. A vivid bright black-cherry core is shaded by cedar, nutmeg and wood-smoke nuances while good acidity and light tannins boost the texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rubino Estates Winery 2015 Reserve Barbera (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Attractive, mature aromatics and complex flavors make this medium-bodied wine worth trying. Notes of tea, leather and wood in the aromas are followed by dried cherry and raspberry flavors and a smooth texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Campos 2016 Estate Barbera (Contra Costa County)

Description: This is a hearty, ripe and full-bodied wine with plenty of black-cherry and balsamic aromas, rich berry and cherry flavors and a hefty texture of moderate tannins and good acidity                      Jim Gordon
Name: Jeremy Wine Co 2016 Noma Vineyard Barbera (Lodi)

Description: This wine has sweet and spicy aromas, oaky flavors and a firm, lightly tannic texture. Combined with strong acidity, the ample oak treatment makes the wine uneven on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: McManis 2017 Jamie Lynn Vineyard Estate Grown Barbera (California)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A smoky petrol aroma and a big tannic mouthfeel give a lot of drama to this full-bodied wine. It has flavors like dried cherries and cranberries, and a dry biting texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Renwood 2016 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine goes for concentration and power but battles an acidic streak. It has a deep color, potent aromas of dried cherries and balsamic, palate-saturating fruit flavors and full body.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Starfield 2016 Barbera (El Dorado)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Italian grapes seem to excel in the Temecula Valley's warm climate, and this is no exception. Light in the glass, the Barbera offers mace and nutmeg aromas against a raspberry-liqueur background. The palate blends cola spice with smooth dried red cherry and a long fennel-laced finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Europa Village 2014 Vienza Barbera (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The smoke, tire rubber and raspberry aromas seem unusual. The candied cranberry and cherry flavors are lighter styled. It's a unique, not entirely successful offering of the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Casa Smith 2016 Cervo Northridge Vineyard Barbera (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe and tangy at once on the nose, this bottling shows berry and overextracted cherry on the nose. Roasted tomato, cherry and licorice spice show on the sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rockin' R Winery 2013 Barbara Anne Barbera (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas start out fruit forward, with notes of raspberry, rose hips, peppermint and cherry along with barrel spices that become more prominent over time. Light but juicy flavors follow, displaying cranberry-like tartness and a pleasing sense of acidity. It doesn't quite stand up on its own but should show well at the dinner table.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Wilridge 2016 Ribbon Ridge Barbera (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Beautiful fruit, flower and spice aromas give way to opulent, rich and complex flavors in this very appealing and polished wine. It has vivid black-cherry flavors, baking-spice accents and a palate-soothing texture of fine-grained tannins and moderate acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Langman Estate 2014 Vincent Henry's Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is an immensely fun, fruity and fresh wine, a vibrant display of delicious youth that's ready to glug now. Light in the glass, the wine shows fruit punch and all manner of red fruit on the nose, along with some carnations. The palate offers red apple and watermelon but with tannic grip and ample spice to make it memorable.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Giornata 2017 Barbera (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a bold, ripe and rich wine that leads with saturated aromas of black fruits. On the palate, it feels broad, gentle and velvety as fine-grained tannins support flavors of blueberry, cocoa and black pepper. Excellent to drink now, it has the requisite tannins, acidity and depth for aging. Best after 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Portalupi 2016 Pauli Ranch Barbera (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Delicious fruit flavors, subtle spices and a generous mouthfeel come together in this full-bodied, luxurious wine. It has a mouth-filling texture due to lots of fine-grained tannins, very ripe and pure black-cherry flavors and excellent concentration that helps extend the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Shooting Star 2016 Barbera (Lake County)

Description: High-powered berry and cherry flavors light up this very focused and purely fruity wine. It is quite full-bodied but not very tannic, and minimal use of oak in the winemaking yields a vibrant, uncomplicated character.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Prima Materia 2016 Estate Barbera

Description: Made with 100% Barbera grapes, this intriguing sparkler opens with aromas of dried rose petal, sandalwood and a whiff of bread dough. On the airy, elegant palate, fresh acidity brightens wild cherry, pomegranate, vanilla and a hint of white almond. A creamy perlage lends elegance.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Montemagno NV TM Brut 24 Metodo Classico Barbera (Vino Spumante)

Description: This bold wine is very ripe in terms of fruit flavor, and shows generous oak spices like cedar, clove and black pepper that meld nicely with its almost jammy blackberry and blueberry flavors. The mouthfeel is broad and velvety.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Westbrook Wine Farm 2015 Laurie's Vineyard Barbera (Madera)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is dark and brooding, offering black-pepper, blackberry and wood-smoke aromas, then potent concentrated fruit flavors on a rather tannic full-bodied frame. Subtle oak spices of wood smoke and clove add complexity on the palate and finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Easton 2015 Cooper Ranch Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a pretty, fruity and focused wine that displays good balance and a sleek texture. It offers plenty of red cherry, black cherry and spice accents that are supported by light tannins and tangy acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Portalupi 2016 Shake Ridge Ranch Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Deep dark fruit flavors are matched by oaky spices in this dark-colored, full-bodied and moderately tannic wine. It has a touch of the varietal's usual acidity underpinning vivid cherry and blackberry flavors, while fine-grained tannins give a velvety feel to the texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Binz 2015 Sleeper-Crain Vineyard Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This crisp, lip-smacking red wine has lots of cherry and cranberry flavors, light to medium body and good balance. It's an appetizing mealtime wine that doesn't steal the show.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Andis 2016 d' Amador Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A smoky sage-like aroma and fruit flavors tinged with earthy, woody accents make this full-bodied wine a bit of a wild card, but an enjoyable one.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap 2016 Barbera (El Dorado)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a good wine that balances ripe berry flavors with lively acidity and medium body. It tastes like sour cherries and raspberries and has a lightly tart mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terra d'Oro 2016 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This big and rather tart wine has a green streak in the piney, woody aromas and flavors that accompany red-cherry and sour-cherry notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Binz 2016 Oleta Vineyard Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine shows a lot of oak influence in the baking-spice aromas, cedar and vanilla flavors and spicy finish. Under the oak are bright raspberry and cherry flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Binz 2016 Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: A heavy oak influence gives this full-bodied wine smoky, charred aromas and flavors that dampen the fruity components that may have been in the grapes. It's bold and spicy.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Blue Victorian Winery 2016 Barbera (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A strong spicy oaky aroma is followed by equally strong oak flavors, so this medium-bodied wine is one-dimensional, without the fruit character that most people like to taste in their wines.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lewis Grace 2016 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Charred wood-smoke aromas and raw oak flavors nearly overwhelm the taste of this heavy-handed and medium-bodied wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Binz 2016 Hanna's Vineyard Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: El Dorado County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a really well-made, flavorful and nicely balanced wine from a new winery that's doing exciting things. It's full bodied, moderately tannic and moderately acidic which is typical of the varietal, but backed by wonderful ripe black-cherry, black-olive and black-pepper flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Via Romano 2015 Barbera (El Dorado County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
