Description: The tasty fruit flavors ring clear as a bell in this berry- and cherry-drenched and mouth-filling wine. It's grapey in a good way, very open and generous in character, and there's little or no oak to mask the fruit.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Naggiar 2016 Estate Grown Root 49 Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A strong earthy meaty aroma is followed by herb, tomato and green-olive flavors in this medium-bodied wine. It has a distinct personality that relies on savory characters and makes a fun change of pace.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Shenandoah Vineyards 2016 ReZerve Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh and tight aromas of boysenberry fruit and star anise show on the nose of this easy-to-enjoy bottling. It's very lively with juicy dark fruits and light baking spice on the palate, making a great pairing for pizza, pasta and burgers.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bella Luna 2016 Glenrose Vineyard Barbera (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Examples of this variety are rare in this state, with this one coming from a hot site and vintage. Blackberry seed, anise, herb stem and dark-plum aromas are followed by rich ripe cherry flavors that persist on the finish. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lobo Hills 2014 StoneTree Vineyard Barbera (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light red-fruit and damp wood aromas show on the nose of this rosé treatment of Barbera, not the most common of varieties for a pink wine. There is a strong lime-skin tang to the palate with deeper cranberry flavors, making for a very full-flavored rosé.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Alara 2017 Rosé of Barbera (San Benito County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cherry candy, raspberry and herb aromas are followed by plump ripe sweet flavors with a warm tangy finish. It comes off as quite ripe.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Maryhill 2015 Proprietor's Reserve Barbera (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, clove and ground pepper mingle with fragrant blue flowers and a whiff of toast. Concentrated and savory, the full-bodied palate doles out blackberry jam, mature Marasca cherry and exotic spices. Velvety tannins lend finesse, while fresh acidity keeps it light on its feet.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Braida di Giacomo Bologna 2015 Bricco dell'Uccellone  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Red-skinned berry, blue flower, wild herb, menthol and clove aromas fill the glass. Smooth and delicious, the elegantly structured palate delivers layers of black cherry, ripe blackberry, mint and licorice framed in polished tannins. Fresh acidity gives it balance and energy. Drink 2019–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2015 La Court Riserva  (Nizza)

Description: Elegantly structured, delicious and loaded with personality, this benchmark Nizza offers earthy aromas of truffle, leather, game, pressed violet and ripe black-skinned fruit. The aromas carry over to the savory palate, along with star anise, black cherry, mature plum and crushed mint. It's balanced by polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2015 Cipressi  (Nizza)

Description: Inviting aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, violet and a whiff of culinary spice lead the nose of this generous, juicy red. The smooth, savory palate doles out succulent Morello cherry, spicy blackberry, white pepper and clove framed in polished tannins. It's balanced by fresh acidity that gives it wonderful energy. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fontanafredda 2016 Papagena  (Barbera d'Alba Superiore)

Description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, purple flower, new leather, crushed mint and baking spice escape the glass. On the full-bodied palate, velvety tannins support juicy Marasca cherry, ripe plum, black pepper and cinnamon. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Braida di Giacomo Bologna 2015 Bricco della Bigotta  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Aromas of violets, dark-skinned berries and menthol slowly take shape in the glass. On the full-bodied, elegantly structured palate, polished tannins support flavors of Marasca cherry, mature blackberry and dark spice. An espresso note lingers on the finish. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Coppo 2015 Pomorosso  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Ripe black-skinned fruit, blue flower, crushed mint and cake spice aromas take center stage, while a balsamic note stays in the background. It's big, juicy and incredibly delicious, as it doles out mouthfuls of ripe plum, succulent blackberry, Marasca cherry and vanilla alongside soft, polished tannins. A star anise note lingers on the close. Drink through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: G D Vajra 2015  Barbera d'Alba Superiore

Description: Aromas of black cherry, tilled soil, blue flower and ground pepper carry over to the chewy, savory palate along with blackberry jam. It's full bodied, with polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2019.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Braida di Giacomo Bologna 2015 Montebruna  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Elegant and savory, this opens with aromas of crushed herbs, wild berries, forest floor and a whiff of graphite. On the smooth palate, polished tannins support flavors of ripe Marasca cherry, raspberry, exotic spice and a hint of orange zest, with vibrant acidity lending balance. It has fantastic freshness and harmony for the hot vintage. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bava 2015 Pianoalto  (Nizza)

Description: Aromas of baked plum, scorched earth, leather and balsamic notes slowly appear in the glass. On the smooth, full-bodied palate, polished tannins support ripe Marasca cherry, mature blackberry, orange zest and tobacco. It closes on a salty note. It's hitting its peak so enjoy over the next few years. Drink through 2021.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Scarpa 2011 La Bogliona  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: Here's a savory juicy red that opens with inviting aromas of blue flower, blackberry, and baking spice. On the round generous palate, smooth tannins give supple support to fleshy black cherry, baked plum, vanilla and clove. Drink through 2021.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca' Viola 2015 Brichet  (Barbera d'Alba)

Description: Earthy aromas evoking underbrush, tilled soil, leather and wild berry take shape on this polished red. It's elegant and medium-bodied, offering juicy red cherry, raspberry and white pepper alongside supple tannins and bright acidity. Drink through 2021.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bava 2014 Stradivario  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This boasts intense aromas that evoke ripe black plum, new leather, clove and purple flowers. The concentrated palate delivers blackberry jam, brandied black cherry, cinnamon and mint, while velvety tannins provide polished support. Drink 2020–2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mirafiore 2016  Barbera d'Alba Superiore

Description: Prunotto 2015 Costamiole Riserva (Nizza). Prune, blackberry, violet and cooking spice aromas lead the nose. On the full-bodied palate, notes of toasted hazelnut and clove accent a black cherry core. Polished tannins provide elegant support, while a hint of mocha marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Prunotto 2015 Costamiòle Riserva  (Nizza)

Description: Aromas of ripe black plum, black-skinned berry and a whiff of violet lead the nose on this irresistibly delicious wine. On the soft, juicy palate, pliant tannins wrap around layers of fleshy black raspberry, succulent Marasca cherry, orange zest and a hint of baking spice. One bottle may not be enough. Drink through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rizzi 2016  Barbera d'Alba

Description: Aromas of prune, fragrant blue flower, truffle and cake spice mingle together in the glass. Smooth and juicy, the medium-bodied palate doles out blackberry, Marasca cherry and cinnamon alongside soft polished tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance. Drink through 2019.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Borgogno 2016  Barbera d'Alba

Description: Aromas of underbrush, spiced plum and a whiff of blue flower form the nose. On the chewy palate, round tannins seamlessly support succulent Marasca cherry, blackberry and white pepper alongside fresh acidity. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Borgogno 2016  Barbera d'Alba Superiore

Description: You'll find alluring aromas of black-skinned fruit and exotic spice on this full-bodied red. On the structured palate, fine-grained tannins support dried cherry, blackberry and clove while a hint of coffee bean closes the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Coppo 2016 Camp du Rouss  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Made with organically grown grapes, this fragrant Barbera offers aromas of violet, dark berry, moist earth and a hint of baking spice. Its savory and supple, with juicy black-cherry, crushed raspberry, white-pepper and star anise flavors set against velvety tannins. Enjoy through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Brandini 2016 Rocche del Santo  (Barbera d'Alba Superiore)

Description: Aromas of blue flowers, underbrush, ripe plum and exotic spice shape the nose. Despite its bold structure and muscle on the palate, it shows surprising finesse in flavors of fleshy blackberry, brandied cherry, star anise and tobacco framed in velvety tannins. Thanks to the succulent fruit, you barely notice the warmth of alcohol on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi Incisa della Rocchetta 2016 Sant'Emiliano  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: Aromas of violet, eucalyptus, red berry and chopped herb emerge on this full-bodied, fragrant Barbera. The structured elegant palate boasts dried black cherry, red-currant jam, cedar and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Rocca 2016 Ròca Neira  (Barbera d'Alba Superiore)

Description: Aromas of eucalyptus, dark berry and cedar lift out of the glass. On the savory, balanced palate, fresh acidity lifts black currant jam, tobacco and licorice while fine-grained tannins offer support. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Barisel 2015 La Cappelletta  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: Intense aromas of violet, iris and wild berry come to the forefront on this big, full-bodied red. The chewy concentrated palate doles out plum, blackberry, cherry soaked in spirits and a hint of vanilla. Round tannins make it approachable, and thanks to the succulent fruit, you almost can't detect the elevated alcohol content. Drink through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Neive 2016 Vigna Santo Stefano  (Barbera d'Alba)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned fruit, blue flower, cooking spice and a whiff of forest floor fill the glass. It's full bodied and juicy, doling out succulent Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry and clove set against tangy acidity and elegant tannins. Drink through 2021.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi Incisa della Rocchetta 2017 Valmorena  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, violet and a whiff of fresh mint lead the nose. The juicy palate delivers blackberry, Marasca cherry, nutmeg and licorice, while fresh acidity and velvety tannins provide balance. Enjoy through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ugo Lequio 2014 Vigna Gallina  (Barbera d'Alba Superiore)

Description: Soft and juicy, this opens with aromas of mature black plum, wild berry, fragrant blue flower and a whiff of chopped mint. On the full-bodied enveloping palate you'll find mouthfuls of fleshy morello cherry, black raspberry and blackberry alongside clove and star anise. Smooth tannins lend elegance. Drink through 2021.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Figli Luigi Oddero 2015  Barbera d'Alba

Description: Wild cherry, red plum, violet and baking spice aromas come front and center along with an earthy whiff of forest floor. On the succulent palate, fresh acidity brightens crushed raspberry, juicy black cherry and baking spice notes. Round tannins give it a smooth, easy-drinking texture. It's not complex but it certainly is delicious. Drink through 2019.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bava 2016  Barbera d'Asti

Description: Fragrant purple flower, baking spice and black-skinned berry aromas mingle with an earthy whiff of forest floor. On the succulent palate, supple tannins and fresh acidity balance juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry and licorice. It's easy drinking and savory. Drink through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2016 Le Orme  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Initially shy, this needed a few minutes in the glass before revealing underbrush, scorched earth, forest floor, wild berry and dark spice aromas. It's full-bodied, doling out ripe black cherry, blackberry, clove and tobacco flavors alongside polished tannins. It closes on an almost salty mineral note. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Prunotto 2015 Bansella  (Nizza)

Description: Made with organic grapes, this opens with aromas of violet, licorice and mature dark berry. The juicy, savory palate offers black cherry, raspberry jam, star anise and chopped herb alongside supple tannins. Drink through 2021.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rivetti Massimo 2016 Froi  (Barbera d'Alba Superiore)

Description: Aromas of woodland berry and dark cooking spice lead the nose. The vibrant, savory palate offers raspberry jam, blackberry and white pepper alongside bright acidity and fine-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Barisel 2015 Listoria  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: Aromas suggesting black-skinned berry, vanilla and a lightly toasted note lift out of the glass. On the palate, fine-grained tannins lightly support black currant, powdered sage, white pepper and a hint of oak.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi di Barolo 2015 Peiragal  (Barbera d'Alba)

Description: Aromas of dark berry, clove and a whiff of violet lead the nose while the juicy palate offers black cherry, licorice and star anise. Fresh acidity and polished tannins lend balance and supple support.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Poderi dei Bricchi Astigiani 2015  Barbera d'Asti Superiore

Description: Aromas of dark berry, blue flower and underbrush take shape in the glass. The savory, balanced palate offers black cherry jam, cedar and licorice alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Rocca 2015 Ròca Neira  (Barbera d'Alba Superiore)

Description: Dark-skinned berry, cooking spice and underbrush aromas emerge from the glass. The savory palate offers black cherry, ground pepper and licorice alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Costa Catterina 2015  Barbera d'Alba

Name: Broccardo 2016 La Martina  (Barbera d'Alba)

Description: This has subdued aromas of red berry and clove. On the straightforward palate, round tannins support blackberry jam, star anise and a hint of ground pepper. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Natale Verga 2016  Barbera d'Asti

Description: This opens with subtle aromas of dark-skinned berry and baking spice. The easygoing palate suggests black plum, licorice and white pepper alongside smooth tannins. It closes on a bitter-almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pietro Rinaldi 2016 Monpiano  (Barbera d'Alba)

Description: This opens with black-skinned berry, underbrush and clove aromas that carry over to the simple palate. Supple tannins and brisk acidity lend support.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vinchio-Vaglio Serra 2016 Sorì dei Mori  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This has subdued red-skinned berry and underbrush aromas. The easygoing palate offers red cherry, clove and white pepper alongside bright acidity and round tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Viotti 2015 Cà Nova  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Subtle aromas evoking dark-skinned fruit and cooking spice come together in the glass. The easygoing palate delivers blackberry jam, clove and licorice alongside polished tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ceste 2015 Sposabella  (Barbera d'Alba)

Description: This opens with scorched earth, underbrush and dark fruit aromas. The straightforward palate offers licorice, tangerine zest and a touch of black currant alongside pliant tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Malgrà 2015 Gaiana  (Barbera d'Alba Superiore)

Description: Black-skinned fruit, purple-flower and wild herb aromas lead the way. On the straightforward palate, soft tannins lightly support juicy black cherry and crushed raspberry. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pico Maccario 2017 Lavignone  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This opens with aromas of red-skinned berry and baking spice. The fruity easy-drinking palate delivers black cherry and clove alongside round tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fratelli Ponte 2017  Barbera d'Asti

Description: This has subdued aromas suggesting red berry and culinary spice. The simple easy-drinking palate offers fleshy black cherry and a hint of clove alongside pliant tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rizieri 2016 Sbilauta  (Barbera d'Alba)

Description: This opens with subdued prune and tilled soil aromas. The simple informal palate offers dried cherry and a hint of star anise alongside loose-knit tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Giacomo Vico 2016  Barbera d'Alba

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals scorched earth and dark-skinned fruit while the simple palate offers dried black cherry, clove and a touch of bitter almond. Assertive tannins provide the framework.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Canti 2013  Barbera d'Asti Superiore

Description: This has earthy aromas of tilled soil, game and a whiff of dark fruit. On the firm palate, assertive, rather astringent tannins frame cedar and dried morello cherry.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paola Lanzavecchia 2014 Seta  (Barbera d'Alba Superiore)

Description: This has aromas suggesting prune and scorched soil. The evolved, no-frills palate offers ground pepper, mocha and a hint of dried cherry alongside loose-knit, rather fleeting tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Araldica 2015 Alasia  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Appellation: Alta Mesa, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a compelling take on a sometimes simply fruity and lively varietal from risk-taking winemaker Kevin Luther. It's medium bodied, well balanced and has a complexity in the aromas and flavors that is fascinating to taste. It blends tasty cherry and raspberry notes with accents of tamarind, black tea and clove.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wise Villa 2015 Estate Barbera (Alta Mesa)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a big wine that shows concentrated berry and black-pepper flavors, with accents of rosemary and wood smoke. Firm tannins and good acidity give plenty of grip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Feist 2016 Reserve Cooper Vineyard Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Light anise, dark red currant and plump cranberry show on the nose of this Barbera bottling, which exhibits potential as a reliable grape for this warm region. Ample marjoram and star anise reside on the buoyant palate, alongside fresh boysenberry and vanilla flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Highland Valley 2015 Barbera (San Diego County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Quite lively in flavor, this medium-bodied wine exudes bright raspberry and red-cherry aromas, and has good acidity and vivid fruit flavors. It should be a versatile food wine due to the pinpoint balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Amador Cellars 2015 Fields Family Vineyards Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This offers jammy cranberry and raspberry aromas, with lemon peel notes and kisses of barrel spice. The palate brings a pleasing texture and sweet fruit flavors, finishing with fruit leather notes. A unique interpretation of a variety rarely seen in Walla Walla Valley.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Viola 2015 Dugger Creek Vineyard Barbera (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Girardet's Bush Vine series explores the winery's recent plantings of Spanish and Italian varieties. It's difficult to coax definitive varietal character from young vine Barbera; this one is not quite there yet but offers straightforward, pleasant fruit, strawberry and cherry flavors and moderate acidity.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Girardet 2015 Bush Vine Barbera (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This light-bodied wine strives for concentration and ripeness, but retains the typical bright acidity of Barbera. It smells like black cherries, tastes like not-quite-ripe blackberries and has a tangy, moderately tannic texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mabera 2015 Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: One of the most concentrated California Barberas on the market, this wine shows a very deep dark color, opulent and ripe fruit aromas and a wonderful sense of layering and density. It oozes blueberries, boysenberries and dark chocolate, has a firmly tannic texture, tasty oak spices and a long lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Naggiar 2015 Estate Grown Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in stainless steel and fermented with native yeasts, this has freshly crushed cranberry, raspberry and lemon peel aromas and pure flavors that undulate across the palate with compelling texture. Fresh raspberry notes persist on the tart finish. It's flat-out delicious and should shine at the dinner table.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Viola 2016 Barbera d'Alder Alder Ridge Vineyard Barbera (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Raspberry, earth and leather aromas lead to rich, deep and savory flavors in this full-bodied, firmly tannic and nicely funky wine. It goes beyond the simple fruit and acidity of many Barberas and adds a lot of complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Noceto 2013 Linsteadt Vineyard Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a smooth mouth-filling wine that's easy to love for its deft combination of ripe plum and black cherry along with chocolate and baking-spice undertones. It feels medium bodied, well balanced and has a touch of tannin to help the texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Iron Hub 2014 Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Superripe in flavor and lush in texture, this is a welcoming wine that tastes very fruity, feels mouth-filling and finishes with a touch of sweetness, partly due to its elevated ripeness level.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Urban Legend 2015 Cooper Ranch Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Dried blackberry, ripe red-melon and plum aromas meet with a touch of leather and funk on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a bit rustic, showing more leather as well as slightly sour red-plum-skin flavors. The tannins are very soft.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Europa Village 2015 Vienza Barbera (Temecula Valley)

Description: Impressive for its combination of grapy richness and spicy oak notes, this medium-bodied wine is showy and attractive. It has moderate tannins and good acidity typical of the variety.                      Jim Gordon
Name: McManis 2016 Jamie Lynn Vineyard Barbera (California)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sleek and lean, this wine blends raspberry aromas with almost-tart raspberry and red-cherry flavors. It is medium bodied and light on the tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Campos Family Vineyards 2015 Gabriel Barbera (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Floral perfumy aromas meet ripe, almost raisiny flavors in this medium-bodied wine. Spicy oaky earthy notes come out on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sobon Estate 2016 Barbera (Amador County)

Description: Red cherry, crushed slate and a pinch of herbs show on the nose of this bottling from the Temecula area, which shows good potential for making solid table wines from this grape. It's light, easy and quaffable on the sip, where gravel and light red-fruit flavors are prominent.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Orange Coast WInery 2015 Barbera (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: In terms of sheer hedonism, this is a successful wine, full of oaky aromas of vanilla cake, caramel and plum pudding, loaded with crème brûlée and ripe fruit flavors. But the oak winds up feeling single-noted by the finish, and the grape seems lost in the seasonings.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Castoro Cellars 2015 Reserve Barbera (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas leap up out of the glass, with exquisite notes of plum, spice and cherry cream. On the palate, it's rich with soft fruit flavors, showing ripeness but still maintaining its balance, with the neutral oak aging bringing an aching sense of purity. Candied-cherry notes linger on the finish. It's a whole lot of wine for the money, with a big yum factor.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Casa Smith 2015 Cervo Northridge Vineyard Barbera (Wahluke Slope)

Description: A rich overlay of cocoa and roasted coffee bean sit atop ripe, brambly notes of blackberry, boysenberry and black cherry on the nose and mouth of this decadent, immediately likeable bottling. The plush mouthfeel offers silky tannins, with ample acidity and hits of toasted oak and fresh mint leaves that add depth and lift through the close.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: The Drift 2015 Gift Horse Barbera (Overberg)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright aromas of raspberry, macerated cranberry, nougat, vanilla and pencil shavings lead to tart puckering fruit flavors that show intensity and length. There is much to enjoy.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Maryhill 2014 Proprietor's Reserve Gunkel Vineyards Barbera (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are light, with notes of mocha, herb, plum and pie cherry along with whiffs of tire rubber. Despite the high alcohol level, the palate shows a fairly elegant sense of styling, tapering toward the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Wind Rose 2014 Omaggio Barbera (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The cranberry and raspberry aromas show volatility that distracts. The flavors are lightly sweet with a tart finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Catman 2015 Barbera (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This is an interesting wine due to the rarity of Barbera in Oregon, but also because it has real varietal character. Dried leaves, tobacco and tanned leather notes highlight its soft plum and cherry flavors. There's a sweet, lightly chocolaty kick to the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cathedral Ridge 2014 Bolton Vineyard Reserve Barbera (Columbia Valley (OR))

Description: Alluring aromas of dark-skinned berry, exotic spice and an earthy note of tilled soil come together in the glass. The elegant, structured palate delivers red currant, Marasca cherry and star anise alongside bright acidity and refined tannins. It's well balanced and delicious. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bava 2014 Piano Alto  (Nizza)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is one of the most Italian-tasting wines made in California, because of its complex blend of spicy earthy characters and moderate fruit flavors, grippy tannins and good acidity. It's nicely dry, well balanced, has interesting oaky accents on top of mildly fruity and also savory notes. Unusual because it's not vintage dated, but don't let that dissuade.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Le Mulet Rouge NV Barbera (Amador County)

Description: Alluring toast and spice aromas lead to bright red cherry and raspberry flavors that are well accented by oak flavors of cinnamon, nutmeg and black pepper. The wine has good complexity combined with a firm and appetizing texture due to moderate tannins and acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oak Farm 2015 Barbera (Lodi)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, violet and underbrush lift from the glass. The juicy lively palate presents red cherry, crushed raspberry and a hint of truffle set against fresh acidity and polished tannins. Enjoy through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bava 2015 Libera  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This opens with aromas of mature plum, violet and an inviting whiff of vanilla. The firm full-bodied palate offers black currant, raspberry jam and clove accompanied by bright acidity and fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi Incisa della Rocchetta 2015 Sant'Emiliano  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Appellation: Barbera d'Asti Superiore Nizza, Piedmont, Italy
Description: Inviting aromas of vanilla, black-skinned berry and a touch of new leather come together on this full-bodied red. The concentrated, hearty palate delivers ripe blackberry, raspberry jam, coffee and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Prunotto 2013 Costamiòle  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore Nizza)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: With very good balance and impressive fruit concentration, this medium-bodied wine will be a good all-occasion wine to buy by the case. It offers focused red and black-cherry flavors, a zingy texture and light tannins so it won't get tiring on the second glass.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella Grace 2014 Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: Aromas of violet, black-skinned berry and a touch of fresh mint lead the nose on this juicy red. The savory palate delivers ripe blackberry, nutmeg and licorice while fresh acidity and silky tannins provide balance. Enjoy through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Giacomo Fenocchio 2015  Barbera d'Alba Superiore

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This brilliant and affordable wine will be amazingly versatile with food, as it shows wonderful ripe black-cherry aromas, equally fruity flavors, and a fresh, almost crisp, texture that's unusual for a red wine. It has good concentration, too, and enough depth to stay interesting.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sobon Estate 2014 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine is well made, well balanced and offers good complexity from earthy spicy notes as well as solid, attractive fruit flavors at its core, including black cherry and raspberry. The texture is smooth and has a good nip of tannin to cleanse the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Feist 2015 Reserve Barbera (El Dorado)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Rich and ripe, this full-bodied wine offers lush black-plum aromas, a palate-coating texture, ripe but not sweet cherry and raisin flavors and a soft velvety mouthfeel. For a varietal known for its acidity, this wine is surprisingly soothing to sip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella Grace 2015 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Barbera d'Asti Superiore Nizza, Piedmont, Italy
Description: Aromas of baked earth, black plum and cocoa lift out of the glass. Round and juicy, the palate delivers mature blackberry, licorice and tobacco alongside velvety tannins. Enjoy through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bersano 2013 Generala  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore Nizza)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Exuberantly fruity, this full-bodied wine smells and tastes like black-cherry juice, and is nicely dry on the palate. Good fruit acidity and moderate tannins balance all the fruit concentration and high alcohol level.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Portalupi 2015 Shake Ridge Ranch Barbera (Amador County)

Description: Aromas suggesting tilled soil, sage and black-skinned fruit come together in the glass. On the firm palate, close-grained tannins support mature black plum, clove and a touch of star anise. Drink through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cà Bianca 2013 Chersi  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Appellation: Barbera d'Asti Superiore Nizza, Piedmont, Italy
Description: Aromas of cooking spice, black-skinned berry and a whiff of tobacco lead the nose. The firm palate delivers blackberry jam, clove and licorice alongside closed-grained tannins. Drink through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Guido Berta 2013  Barbera d'Asti Superiore Nizza

Appellation: Naches Heights, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are quite muted, not revealing much about what's inside the glass. It's a shame because the palate is quite flavorful, ripe with cherry and spice flavors that show persistence. If the two come together it could move up a notch.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Wilridge 2014 Estate Barbera (Naches Heights)

Description: This opens with delicate aromas suggesting mocha, black-skinned berry and vanilla. The dense palate delivers black currant jam, clove and tobacco alongside taut tannins. Enjoy through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Fiorita 2011 Il Giorgione  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, black plum and baking spice. Reflecting the nose, the bright palate delivers black currant, white pepper and star anise alongside fresh acidity and round tannins. Enjoy through 2019.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Guido Berta 2015  Barbera d'Asti

Appellation: Barbera d'Asti Superiore Nizza, Piedmont, Italy
Description: This offers aromas of tilled soil, black-skinned berry and a whiff of baking spice. The round palate presents vanilla, clove and blackberry jam alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2019.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tre Secoli 2013  Barbera d'Asti Superiore Nizza

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine is superfruity, gushing black-cherry syrup aromas and ripe concentrated cherry flavors backed by good acidity and very mild tannins. It emphasize the crisp zingy character that's inherent in the grape variety while being very full bodied.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Portalupi 2015 Pauli Ranch Barbera (Mendocino County)

Description: This has subdued aromas suggesting black-skinned fruit and baking spice. The straightforward palate evokes raspberry jam, clove and a hint of star anise alongside supple tannins. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Fiorita 2013  Barbera d'Asti Superiore

Description: This has subtle aromas evoking cocoa, black plum and leather while the evolved palate shows prune, vanilla and a hint of orange zest. Smooth tannins provide loose support. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vinchio-Vaglio Serra 2009 Insynthesis  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Gutsy and full-bodied, this small-production wine offers more structure than usual, its bright acidity and ripe tannins in full support of the tasty red and black cherry flavors. With earth, beef and oak nuances, it will taste great with hearty proteins, especially after some cellaring. Best after 2020.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Andis 2015 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Beautifully polished, this wine has an alluring blend of fruit and spice flavors and an especially lush texture. The bouquet evokes violets, raspberries and blueberries, and the palate goes deeper into blackberry and clove flavors. The balance is great because it matches its acidity with a feeling of richness and length.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sera Fina 2013 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A wonderful bouquet, like that of a well-aged wine, helps this spicy, fruity bottling stand out. It has gorgeous floral, tamarind and cola aromas, generous fruity flavors and a smooth, lightly tannic texture. An unusual and delicious twist on the variety.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Tanner 2014 Estate Grown Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This especially ripe and deep style of Barbera grown at the Miraflores property looks quite dark, smells like dried fruit and tastes rich and full-bodied. It has admirable concentration, a smooth and layered texture and good length on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Miraflores 2014 Estate Barbera (El Dorado)

Description: Superfresh raspberry aromas, rich cherry flavors and a texture that helps all that fruit cling to the palate make this medium-bodied wine compelling. It feels firm and structured due to good acidity, which supports the surprisingly bright and layered fruit flavors very well.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Uvaggio 2014 Barbera (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Mineral and black pepper flavors help this dry and full-boded wine stand out from the pack. It has lightly earthy, smoky aromas and bold fruit flavors supported by firm tannins and acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap 2014 Estate Bottled Barbera (El Dorado)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Effusive fruit flavors and a vibrant texture make this wine easy to pair with a meal. Spicy, chocolatey aromas meet cherry and raspberry flavors while full body lends richness in the mouthfeel and length on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Easton 2014 Cooper Ranch Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine has wild berry aromas, rich cherry syrup and vanilla flavors and a lively but smooth texture. It tastes extremely floral and candy-like without being literally sweet.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scott Harvey 2014 J&S Reserve Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This easy-drinking wine is full of fruit in the aromas and flavors and has a smooth, non-tannic texture and full body. Its concentrated raspberry and red cherry aromas are followed by ripe plum and cherry flavors, with juicy acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Yorba 2012 Shake Ridge Vineyards Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This very good, well-balanced wine combines savory, smoky elements with tasty, bright fruit flavors recalling red cherry and plum. It's medium bodied and has enough concentration to be interesting.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Easton 2014 Monarch Mine Vineyard Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Lively, fruity and well made, this wine has plenty of raspberry and cherry flavors, good acidity and light tannins to add a bit of grip to the texture. For a medium-bodied wine, it has nice concentration.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Renwood 2014 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Bright fruit flavors light up this tart, medium-bodied wine. It smells like raspberries and red cherries, tastes crisp and bright and has a light nip of cranberry-like astringency.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wilderotter 2014 Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine smells and tastes quite mature but is still interesting to drink. It has sun-baked earth aromas, raspberry and Madeira flavors and a soft texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Jodar 2013 Barbera (El Dorado)

Description: One of Italy's most iconic wines, this structured red opens with heady aromas of red berry, menthol and dark spice. Those alluring qualities carry over to the full-bodied, inviting palate, along with raspberry compote and licorice notes. Firm yet velvety tannins and bright acidity provide balance and the structure to age. Drink 2019–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Braida di Giacomo Bologna 2014 Bricco dell'Uccellone  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Dark-skinned berry, exotic spice, leather and pressed blue flower are just some of the aromas you'll find in this gorgeous red. The elegant, firmly structured palate doles out juicy Marasca cherry, cassis, licorice and espresso flavors framed by polished tannins. It's extremely well balanced, with bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Braida di Giacomo Bologna 2014 Bricco della Bigotta  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This is the 30th anniversary edition of this wine and it doesn't disappoint. It opens with intense dark-skinned berry, exotic spice, blue flower and French oak aromas. The savory and fresh palate delivers crushed red cherry, cassis, licorice and espresso flavors structured with fine-grained tannins. Bright acidity lends balance while a mineral note lingers on the finish. Drink through 2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Coppo 2014 Pomorosso  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Enticing scents of fragrant blue flower, forest berry and Alpine herb take center stage in this elegant and structured red. The vibrant palate delivers juicy red cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and tobacco hints alongside bright acidity and polished tannins. Impeccably balanced and delicious, it also offers incredible value. Drink through 2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Braida di Giacomo Bologna 2014 Monte Bruna  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Intriguing aromas of forest floor, dark berry, new leather and crushed herb lead the nose of this wine. The savory, firm palate offers succulent Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and white pepper flavors, with refined tannins and a backbone of firm acidity. A smoky note closes the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bava 2013 Stradivario  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Appellation: Barbera d'Asti Superiore Nizza, Piedmont, Italy
Description: This wine's mature black plum, exotic spice, French oak and underbrush aromas take shape in the glass. Bold, full-bodied and savory, it delivers dried black cherry, raspberry jam, vanilla and tobacco flavors enveloped in velvety tannins. Fresh acidity lifts the mineral-laced finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Coppo 2009 Riserva della Famiglia  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore Nizza)

Description: This wine's ripe, dark-skinned fruit, culinary spice and new leather scents lead the way, along with a menthol note. The firmly structured, chewy palate offers dried Morello cherry, raspberry jam, licorice and espresso flavors alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Coppo 2015 Camp du Rouss  (Barbera d'Asti)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The only varietally labeled Barbera from the Rocks District, this offers intriguing notes of currant, savory herb, pipe tobacco and moist earth. The palate is light in body, with a mix of fruit and savory flavors that carry through to the cranberry-inflected finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Casa Smith 2013 Jack's Vineyard Barbera (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This wine's wild berry, violet, porcini, forest floor and crushed herb aromas leap out of the glass. The vibrant, focused palate evokes wild cherry, cranberry, star anise and orange zest. It's a classic Barbera framed by firm acidity and refined tannins that shows its Nizza origins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2014 Cipressi  (Nizza)

Description: This enjoyable wine's fruity black-skinned berry, violet and baking spice aromas leap out of the glass. The full-bodied palate doles out mouthfuls of juicy black cherry and ripe blackberry flavors alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity. Thanks to succulent fruit and freshness, the alcohol is seamlessly integrated.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi Incisa della Rocchetta 2016 Valmorena  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This offers alluring black-skinned berry, violet and tobacco aromas. The savory, structured palate delivers black cherry and chopped mint flavors, with clove accents, bright acidity and fine-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Castlet 2015 Passum  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Ripe black-skinned fruit, dark spice, underbrush and roasted coffee aromas lead the nose of this wine, along with an earthy note of game. The rounded, chewy palate is loaded with black cherry, black raspberry, baking spice and truffle flavors set against fresh acidity and polished tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2015 Le Orme  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Inviting aromas of violet and ripe red-skinned berry take center stage in this wine. The lively, full-bodied palate doles out juicy raspberry, red cherry and cinnamon flavors framed by velvety tannins and zesty acidity. Enjoy through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Damilano 2016  Barbera d'Asti

Description: This wine's tilled earth, coffee and black plum aromas waft out of the glass. The hearty, full-bodied palate doles out mature black cherry, licorice and baking spice flavors alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2021.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Cascinone 2014 d'Annona  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This textbook Barbera opens with classic varietal aromas of dark berry, blue flower and ground spice. The vibrant, full-flavored palate offers juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry and licorice notes alongside fresh acidity and smooth tannins. It's made for sheer drinking pleasure, so enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Coppo 2016 L'Avvocata  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Intense aromas of blackberry, violet and eucalyptus take shape in this. The juicy, concentrated palate doles out raspberry jam, ripe black cherry, clove and licorice flavors framed by fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vigne dei Mastri 2014 Galileo  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This leads with forest floor, blue flower and black-skinned berry aromas while the structured, savory palate offers black cherry, red plum and Asian spice hints. Supple tannins and vibrant acidity provide easygoing support and freshness. Enjoy through 2021.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vite Colte 2015 La Luna e i Falò  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This dense, savory wine has tobacco, black-skinned berry and red plum aromas and licorice, blackberry jam and black pepper flavors. Fine-grained tannins provide support. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello Gabiano 2011 Adornes  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This has black-skinned berry, mocha and tilled soil aromas. The concentrated palate doles out blackberry, clove and anise flavors alongside fresh acidity and fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2021.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vite Colte 2015 La Luna e i Falò  (Nizza)

Description: This boasts violet, red-skinned berry and white pepper aromas. The juicy palate delivers strawberry, red cherry and anise notes against a backdrop of round tannins and refreshing acidity. Drink through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Scagliola 2015 Frem  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Black-skinned berry, tilled soil and baking spice aromas lead the way in this wine. Made from very old vines, it delivers blackberry, star anise and clove flavors alongside round tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy through 2021.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vinchio-Vaglio Serra 2011 Vecchie Vigne 50  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This wine's violet and red-skinned berry aromas lift out of the glass. The palate is bright and racy, with juicy raspberry, red cherry and cake spice notes and lively acidity. Drink through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Castlet 2015 Litina  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Made from organic grapes, this bright red opens with violet, red-skinned berry and white pepper scents. The juicy palate doles out ripe raspberry, red cherry and star anise notes, with fresh acidity and velvety tannins. Enjoy through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vite Colte 2016 Rossofuoco  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Red-skinned berry, red plum and baking spice aromas come together in this wine. The bright palate offers black cherry, ground black pepper and anise flavors framed by fresh acidity. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello Gabiano 2015 La Braja  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This has subdued aromas of baking spice and black-skinned fruit. The smooth, rounded palate delivers clove, black cherry and licorice flavors alongside polished tannins. It's already rather evolved so drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca' de Lion Ghione 2010 Barrique  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This has violet, black-skinned berry and herb aromas. The bright, savory palate offers juicy raspberry, star anise and clove flavors alongside velvety tannins and refreshing acidity. Enjoy through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Podere dei Brichhi Astigiani 2015  Barbera d'Asti

Description: This leads with violet, black-skinned berry and baking spice aromas while red cherry, raspberry and white pepper flavors mark the savory palate. Smooth tannins and bracing acidity provide balance. Enjoy through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi di Barolo 2016  Barbera d'Alba

Description: This opens with spiced blueberry, red plum and tilled earth aromas while the medium-bodied palate doles out blackberry, black cherry and clove flavors. Fine-grained tannins and firm acidity provide support. Drink through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bersano 2015 Cremosina  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This wine's black-skinned berry, cooking spice and violet aromas drift out of the glass while the racy palate offers ripe black cherry and cranberry jam flavors with a touch of clove. Brisk acidity and supple tannins provide the framework. Enjoy through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Poderi dei Bricchi Astigiani 2014 Bricco del Perg  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, blue flower and a whiff of clove. The straightforward palate offers tart red currant, orange zest and ground pepper alongside brisk acidity. Drink soon to catch the fruit richness.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Castlet 2016  Barbera d'Asti

Description: This opens with black-skinned berry, dried violet and star anise aromas. The savory, easy-drinking palate delivers blackberry, black pepper and clove flavors set against bright acidity and supple tannins. Enjoy through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello del Poggio 2015  Barbera d'Asti

Description: Ripe black-skinned berry and black plum aromas take center stage in this wine, along with a whiff of toast. The dense palate shows black cherry, licorice and mocha touches framed by firm tannins. Drink through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Cascinone 2014 Rive  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: Intense violet, red-skinned berry and cooking spice aromas set the stage in this bright red. The lively palate delivers red cherry, blackberry and cinnamon touches alongside round tannins and lively acidity. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Falchetto 2016 Pian Scorrone  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This opens with rose petal, red-skinned berry and cake spice aromas. It's bright and easy drinking on the palate, with Morello cherry, raspberry jam and cinnamon flavors. Vibrant acidity and smooth tannins lend easygoing support. Enjoy through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Caldera 2015  Barbera d'Asti

Description: This leads with black-skinned berry, violet and eucalyptus aromas. The solid palate doles out blackberry jam, clove and black pepper notes alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vigne dei Mastri 2015 Arturo  (Barbera d'Asti)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Walla Walla Valley Barbera is rare, although this producer consistently makes one. Its toasty spice, tart cherry and herb aromas give way to well-balanced plum and cherry flavors, needing food to truly shine.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Woodward Canyon 2014 Estate Barbera (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This opens with violet, red plum and white pepper aromas that carry over to the solid, straightforward palate alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon to enjoy the fresh fruit.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Dogliotti 1870 2016  Barbera d'Asti

Description: This has red-skinned berry and baking spice aromas and a lively palate accented with clove. Smooth tannins provide supple support. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fonte 2016  Barbera d'Asti

Description: Ripe black plum, toasted oak and menthol aromas lead the way in this wine. The firm palate offers blackberry jam, vanilla and licorice flavors set against grainy tannins. Drink through 2019.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tre Secoli 2015 Sorangela  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This opens with delicate aromas of baking spice and black-skinned fruit. The simple palate offers black cherry jam, vanilla and white pepper hints while smooth tannins lend supple support. Drink through 2019.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Daniele Reale 2013 La Fiù  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This Barbera's black cherry, blackberry and clove aromas segue to its simple palate. Supple tannins and brisk acidity lend support. Drink through 2019.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vinchio-Vaglio Serra 2015 I Tre Vescovi  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: At first shy on the nose, this opens to reveal baking spice and dried violet aromas. A tobacco note underscores its mature black plum and ripe blackberry flavors while smooth tannins offer easygoing support. Drink through 2019.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fratelli Ponte 2015  Barbera d'Asti Superiore

Description: This wine's baking spice, vanilla and black-skinned berry aromas drift out of the glass. The straightforward palate offers mature black cherry, clove and tobacco flavors while rounded tannins lend easygoing support. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pico Maccario 2015 Tre Roveri  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This leads with vanilla, ripe black-skinned berry and baking spice aromas. The firm palate delivers tobacco, licorice and black cherry jam flavors alongside chewy tannins. It finishes on an astringent note. Drink through 2019.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Scagliola 2014 Sansi Frem  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This chewy wine has vanilla, mature black-skinned berry and clove scents. The palate doles out black cherry jam, marinated prune and licorice flavors, with a warm finish that suggests elevated alcohol. Drink through 2019.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Falchetto 2015 Bricco Paradiso  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: Violet, baking spice and dark berry aromas lead the nose of this zesty, straightforward wine. The palate offers dried cherry, black currant and clove flavors framed by rounded tannins. Enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Antale 2015  Barbera d'Asti

Description: This opens with black-skinned berry, clove and cooking spice aromas. The straightforward palate shows ripe black cherry, black plum and white pepper notes alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pico Maccario 2016 Lavignone  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This has black-skinned berry, forest floor and toast scents. The easygoing palate delivers tart cherry, vanilla and clove flavors alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2019.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cà Bianca 2014 Antè  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This offers subtle black-skinned berry and cooking spice aromas. The straightforward palate evokes ripe blackberry, tobacco and licorice and is blanketed with velvety tannins. Drink through 2019.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bersano 2015 Costalunga  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This opens with red-skinned berry, blue flower and clove aromas. The racy, straightforward palate offers cassis, orange zest and ground pepper flavors alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Natale Verga 2015  Barbera d'Asti

Description: This wine's subtle aromas of black-skinned berry, pressed violet and cooking spice emerge in the glass. The dense palate offers ripe black plum, licorice and leather hints, with chewy tannins and heat from evident alcohol. Drink through 2019.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta San Mauro 2013  Barbera d'Asti Superiore

Description: This opens with tobacco, black-skinned fruit and underbrush aromas. The straightforward palate offers black cherry fruit with hints of white pepper and nutmeg structured with rounded tannins. Enjoy through 2019.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: San Silvestro 2014  Barbera d'Asti Superiore

Description: Black plum, crushed violet and cooking spice aromas lead the nose of this easy-drinking red. The round palate delivers dried cherry, blackberry jam and licorice notes alongside firm tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Cascinone 2015 Crocera  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This informal red has delicate black-skinned fruit and baking spice aromas. The simple palate suggests black plum and clove, with a touch of tobacco. It's not very intense and already extremely accessible, so drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: CarlindePaolo 2016 Cursus Vitae  (Barbera d'Asti)

Description: This leads with subtle black plum and cooking spice scents. The simple palate shows clove, tobacco and blackberry flavors. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Radice 2015 Roccanera  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This wine's subdued baking spice, clove and mature black-skinned fruit aromas follow through to the lively, simple palate. Round tannins provide easygoing support. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Radice 2015 S. Martino  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This opens with restrained cooking spice and dark-skinned berry aromas. The lively, informal palate offers red cherry, white pepper and anise hints, with soft tannins and brisk acidity. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca' de Lion Ghione 2014 Le Muccie  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: Subdued aromas of dried black fruit and baking spice set the tone in this wine. Its easygoing, straightforward palate offers mature Morello cherry and vanilla flavors alongside round tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Araldica 2015 Castelvero Albera  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This simple wine has subdued red-skinned berry and truffle aromas. The lively, easygoing palate suggests black cherry and clove. Vibrant acidity and rounded tannins provide structure. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Viotti 2014  Barbera d'Asti

Description: Restrained at first on the nose, this wine eventually reveals black fruit, cooking spice and underbrush aromas. The simple palate offers dried blackberry and tobacco hints while smooth tannins provide easygoing support. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Araldica 2015 Castelvero Alasia  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: This has subdued prune and tilled soil aromas. The simple, informal palate offers Morello cherry and black pepper flavors alongside loose-knit tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: San Silvestro 2014  Barbera d'Asti

Description: This opens with intense aromas of violet, ripe dark-skinned berry and baking spice. The bright, succulent palate shows black cherry, crushed raspberry and black pepper alongside fresh acidity and smooth tannins. Enjoy through 2018.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fontanafredda 2015 Raimonda  (Barbera d'Alba)

Description: This lively, fizzy Barbera opens with juicy aromas of red berry, strawberry and a note of white pepper that carry over to the vivacious palate alongside smooth tannins and refreshing acidity. It's made to be enjoyed in its youth so drink soon. Serve it slightly chilled for an ideal summer red.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Braida di Giacomo Bologna 2015 La Monella  (Barbera del Monferrato)

Description: Easy drinking and enjoyable, this opens with aromas of blackberry, spiced plum and a whiff of tilled earth. The medium-bodied palate provides juicy black cherry and licorice alongside supple tannins. It's made for sheer drinking pleasure so enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fontanafredda 2015 Briccotondo Barbera (Piemonte)

Description: This offers aromas of red berry, leafy underbrush and a whiff of chopped mint. The juicy palate delivers succulent black cherry, orange zest and ground pepper alongside sleek tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mirafiore 2015  Barbera d'Alba Superiore

Description: Aromas of coconut, spice and vanilla segue over to the round juicy palate along with ripe red berry and ground pepper. Bright acidity and lithe tannins provide the framework.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tre Secoli 2016 San Pietro  (Barbera d'Asti)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a hearty version of a grape frequently made in a simpler, fresh style, showing roasted red berry, charcoal and mocha aromas on the nose. A deep cassis flavor permeates the palate, with beef char and black pepper accents that make for a compelling, rather lavish sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pianetta 2014 Barbera (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is not your parents' crisp and lean Barbera. Ripe, juicy and concentrated, it's so rich and opulent that it seems sweet. From the aromas through the lingeirng finish, it generously doles out raspberry syrup and blackberry jam notes, as well as a chocolaty accent from oak.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Las Positas 2013 Reserve Estate Barbera (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Wonderfully smooth and layered, this medium-bodied wine smells like fresh berries, tastes fruity and mildly spicy and feels silky in the mouth. The components are beautifully balanced, as fresh acidity lifts the fruitiness and mild tannins add a velvety touch.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Spicy Vines 2014 Barbarian Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This concentrated, assertive Barbera is also expertly balanced. Its black plum juice and spicy, smoky oak aromas lead to rich blackberry and black plum flavors coupled with velvety texture and full body. Moderate tannins provide some grip in the mouth, but the finish is smooth.                      Jim Gordon
Name: High Valley Vineyard 2014 High Valley Barbera (Lake County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This luxurious and well-mannered wine was aged in a new but un-toasted French cask. Solid structure supports its ample fruit flavors and full body, lending balance. Bright acidity and moderate tannins add texture on the palate, framing its ripe black cherry, blueberry and dark chocolate flavors nicely.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Renwood 2014 Grand Reserve Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: Spicy, peppery, charred oak aromas meet rich blackberry and boysenberry flavors in this expressive, full-bodied and dry wine. It's rather heavy on the oak, which serves to add complexity and firm tannin, keeping it well-structured through the spicy finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Shannon Ridge 2014 Home Ranch Reserve Barbera (High Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied Barbera's especially dark, opaque color is difficult to miss, and its aromas are equally intense. It smells like a late harvest wine, and its blackberry jam and cherry compote flavors seem to coat the palate. Although dry, it's ripe to the extreme and structured with moderate tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Las Positas 2013 Estate Barbera (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Elegant in texture and concentrated in flavor, this medium-bodied wine has fresh blackberry and blueberry aromas paired with ripe fruit flavors and an easygoing texture without a lot of tannin. Black pepper and cardamom whiffs add some complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Andis 2014 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Cherry and raspberry aromas are accented by a spicy, earthy quality in this easy-drinking, well-balanced wine, and the flavors gush with fruit. It's smooth and polished on the palate, medium in body and light in tannin.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Brooklyn West 2012 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is the perfect wine for a casual night of pizza and pasta: complex enough to keep you interested, but fun enough to quaff without worrying too much. Aromas of wild raspberries, graphite and woody spice lead into tangy cranberry touches on the sip. The strong acidity adds to the wine's food-friendly spiciness.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Giornata 2015 Barbera (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This dull, rustic wine offers earth and anise flavors around a core of soft cherry fruit. Light bodied, its acidity is moderate and unobtrusive.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Orsi Family Vineyards 2013 Barbera (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A touch of new oak in the aroma and bright raspberry and cherry in the flavors make this medium-bodied wine easy to sip and enjoy. Typical for the grape variety, it has noticeable liveliness in the texture and a bit of tang on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Solitary Cellars 2013 Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This grape is still finding its way to consistency in California, and this bottling combines interesting black raspberry and reductive tar notes. It's light in body, with red raspberry fruit flavors and pencil shaving accents. Best served with food, since it doesn't offer a lot of compelling character on its own.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Parker 2014 Alisos Vineyard Barbera (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine from a small, high-elevation district in Lake County adds fresh cherry and raspberry aromas to rich, softly spicy fruit and oak flavors. Smooth and easy in texture, it's supported by good acidity and moderate tannnis in a style for which Barbera is well known in Italy.                      Jim Gordon
Name: High Valley Vineyard 2013 Barbera (High Valley)

Description: This is a handsome wine all the way, from the lightly spicy aromas through the layered fruit, chocolate and cinnamon flavors, to the moderately tannic and lingering finish. With its great balance and mouthwatering flavors, it will be a tasty addition to almost any meal.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Monte Smith 2014 Pauli Ranch Barbera (Mendocino)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Deep color and lots of concentration make this full-bodied wine stand out. It has smoky, black-peppery aromas along with ripe but not sweet blackberry and black-cherry flavors. Firm tannins add texture. This boldness needs rich food for a pairing.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Naggiar 2014 Reserve Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Allspice, cinnamon cookies and nutmeg kick off the nose of this bottling, then come turned earth and blueberry fruit. Hearty blueberry and blackberry fruits show on the sip alongside coffee grinds and cooked meats. It's quite hearty in structure, but fruity all around.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pianetta 2013 Barbera (Central Coast)

Description: Apropos of the winery name, this wine has a beautiful oak blanket wrapped around its cherry and raspberry flavors. Clove, cinnamnon and cedar aromas lead to mulled-wine characteristics on the palate. It's a very perfumed and attractive wine for oak lovers.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oak Farm 2014 Barbera (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Mellow, smooth and lightly spicy, this wine is well balanced and polished. It shows lots of berry flavors plus a bit of cedar and cinnamon while cleansing the palate with good fruit acidity and light tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Enotria 2012 Barbera (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Gushing blackberry aromas and flavors along with a lean, rather crisp texture make this medium-bodied, somewhat tannic wine fun to drink. It would go with casual and rich foods like ribs or fried chicken.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Naggiar 2014 Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: An unusually light brownish color leads to earthy aromas and subtle earthy, cola-like flavors. This wine tastes overly mature for its age but is interesting to taste.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Domenico 2011 Barbera (Lake County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is an interesting medium-bodied wine from one of the oldest and largest wineries in the foothills. It is not heavy or rich, but has an appetizing dry flavor and firm texture. It will pair well with food since it has good balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terra d'Oro 2014 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of red fruit, game and vanilla are followed by quite tart puckering fruit flavors. It needs food to counteract the screaming acid.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Oak Knoll 2011 Goose Ridge Vineyard Barbera (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This vibrant wine shows how well this grape variety does in Amador County. It melds beautiful, pure, almost jammy aromas and flavors with a rich, layered and soothing texture. The color is quite dark, the aromas drip blackberry and boysenberry, the flavors are deep and the mouthfeel broad.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Portalupi 2014 Shake Ridge Ranch Barbera (Amador County)

Description: Juicy and inviting, this is a bright red-fruited wine accented in anise. Soft, integrated oak and tannin allow the vibrant, happy acidity to shine atop full-bodied generosity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Seghesio 2013 Barbera (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Well balanced and appetizing, this medium-bodied wine has fresh jammy flavors and a texture that's light enough to pair with all kinds of food. It tastes fruity and feels sleek on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Boeger 2013 Barbera (El Dorado)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A dramatic oak influence brings aromas of wood smoke and nutmeg to this ripe and otherwise fruity wine. The flavors are vivid raspberry and red cherry, and the texture is smooth with a good coating of tannin for mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Muscardini 2012 Pauli Ranch Barbera (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A welcome presence of clean, spicy oak aromas and flavors lifts this full-bodied and fruity wine to a higher level of complexity. It's elegant in balance and smooth in texture, showing a lingering, light spicy finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Helwig 2013 Reserve Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Concentrated and fruity, this enjoyable wine has savory aromas like sage and earth combining with bright and ripe blackberry and cherry flavors on a smooth but firmly tannic texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Boeger 2014 Barbera (El Dorado)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine shows the fresh, juicy raspberry character of the grape. It has fruity aromas, fresh berry and cherry flavors and a deceptively full body, with a good streak of crispness on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Portalupi 2014 Pauli Ranch Barbera (Mendocino County)

Description: From the producer's estate, this zesty wine is easygoing and softly tart, a mix of plum, strawberry and leathery texture that should shine next to a pizza pie.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kunde 2013 Destination Series Estate Grown Barbera (Sonoma Valley)

Description: This wine is heavily oaked, yet rich and enjoyable. Smoky, spicy, almost sweet aromas and flavors are backed by ripe blackberry flavors and a smooth texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: McManis 2015 Jamie Lynn Vineyard Barbera (California)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light, oaky spices and rich berry flavors mix it up in this tangy, somewhat tannic wine. It's full bodied but the firm acidity and fine-grained tannins keep it lively.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rubino Estates Winery 2012 Famiglia Collection Barbera (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine shows how aromatic and floral this varietal can be. It offers clove and rose petal along with raspberry in the aromas. The full body is supported by good acidity and moderate tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Barrel Racer 2013 Barbera (Yolo County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Peppery and beefy in aroma, this wine is heavy on the savory components and rather lean on fruit flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dante Robere 2014 Tracy Hills Barbera (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: What's this? Single-vineyard Barbera coming from The Rocks District? It's a stunner, with notes of crushed rock and gravel, red and black currants and smoke that show outrageous minerality. The mouthfeel is flat out stunning, showing subtlety and suppleness, with fruit and savory flavors lingering on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Casa Smith 2012 Jack's Vineyard Barbera (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Steve Clifton captures freshness and vibrancy like few winemakers. This bottling shows deep and inviting tones of olallieberry, dill, anise, lavender and lilac on the nose. Powerful boysenberry fruit is lifted by spicy black pepper and even a chile zest on the palate, where strong acidity and firm tannins ensure long aging potential. It still needs a little time.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Palmina 2013 Walker Vineyard Barbera (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the inaugural release of this wine. It shows aromas of dried herbs, plums and currants that lead to a full-bodied and full-flavored palate. It's a mouthful of juicy fruit flavors that delights the senses, with the feel simply dazzling.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Casa Smith 2014 Cervo Northridge Vineyard Barbera (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked strawberry, leather and a touch of caramel show on the nose of this dusty, rustic take on the Italian grape. The flavors are similar to the nose, with lots of turned earth sprinkled over a brighter, acid-driven black-cherry background.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sarah's Vineyard 2012 Barbera (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This vibrant, full-bodied wine combines truly vibrant fruit flavors like black cherry and black grapes with a broad and juicy texture. It delivers a sense of layering of fruit flavors on the palate and a lingering, ripe finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Las Positas 2012 Estate Barbera (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
