Description: Ripe fruit and lush but subtle oak accents make a good combo in this full-bodied, complex and layered wine. Generous, ripe plum notes harmonize with light cinnamon and cocoa accents.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Miraflores 2012 Miraflores Vineyards Barbera (El Dorado)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine gets more interesting with each sip, as generous cherry flavors gather light and almost sweet oak accents, and as fine-grained tannins build the texture. The flavors become mellow and more complex as they echo on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella Grace 2013 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: Extremely pure and concentrated cherry flavors give this full-bodied wine lots of depth, and length on the finish, too. The texture is nice and firm due to fine-grained tannins, and there's a tangy touch from good acidity. A dash of oak comes through but the focus is really on the fruit flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: High Valley Vineyard 2012 Barbera (High Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a firmly structured and full-bodied wine with great grip in the texture and lots of oak flavor and tannin. The rich fruit flavors are dominated by the grip now, but that should change with time. It's best to drink after 2018.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap 2013 Estate Bottled Barbera (El Dorado)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine has lightly spicy aromas, good, mouthfilling fruit flavors and a smooth texture. Words like suave and velvety come to mind. It's a very nice effort for the winery's first Barbera.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sierra Starr 2013 Cooper Vineyard Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Smoky, nutty aromas blend well with rich, baked-fruit flavors and baking spices in this broadly built, velvet-textured and full-bodied wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wilderotter 2013 Estate Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A strong oak influence adds a lot of maple syrup and toasted spice flavors to dark-fruit notes in this full-bodied and firmly tannic wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Shooting Star 2013 Barbera (Lake County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Full of cherry, cola and plum flavors, this medium-bodied wine has an intense fruitiness shaded by baking spices from oak, and a nicely tannic texture. Aged for 20 months in French barrels, it's an attractive, well-aged, easy-to-enjoy wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: La Folia Winery 2012 Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fresh, ripe black-cherry aromas and flavors fuel this medium-bodied, fruit-forward wine. It has a nice, smooth texture, very light tannins and an high drinkability factor.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scott Harvey 2013 Mountain Selection Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright aromas of macerated cranberries and maraschino cherries along with vanilla and wood spice accents are followed by tart and appealing fruit flavors. The oak gets a bit too prominent.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Bethany Vineyard 2013 Reserve Estate Produced Barbera (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine features bright black-cherry aromas and flavors, and rather crisp acidity. The nose is quite fruity and focused, while flavors are mouthfilling, fresh but ripe. Firm and almost crisp in texture, it is quite full bodied but well balanced.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Château Élan 2013 La Barbera Barbera (America)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has that warm, spicy, friendly feel of new oak that is well integrated with the fruit flavors, and a velvety texture to match. It smells like toasted baguette, nutmeg and vanilla and tastes almost as rich as blackberry jam, but stays dry and full-bodied. It's so easy to enjoy.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2013 Reserve Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Concentrated fruit aromas, deep fruit flavors and a supportive, nicely astringent mouthfeel give this wine a great sense of structure and depth. It balances generosity with a bit of reserve in a traditional way that's very appealing. Best through 2020.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Borjón 2013 Complejo Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is concentrated, richly textured and full of great dark fruit character. It smells like plump blackberries and raspberries, tastes ripe, lush in the mouth, and lingering on the finish. What's more, it has very good balance, full body and well-integrated tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2013 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Smoky, earthy, black pepper aromas make this wine catchy at the first sniff, and then the flavors fill the mouth with similarly spicy, earthy suggestions. It is full-bodied, firm-textured and quite concentrated. Pour this with venison or smoked duck or another game dish if possible.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Boeger 2013 Barbera (El Dorado)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Whiffs of cedar and baking spices lead to ripe blackberry and boysenberry flavors in this well-balanced and easy to appreciate wine. The ample fruit flavors are hard to resist, and the supple, modestly tannic texture is just right.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Amador Cellars 2013 Cooper & Karmere Vineyards Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Meaty, smoky aromas and good, high-amplitude fruit flavors give a robust personality to this full-bodied, dry and firmly tannic wine. It will make a good pairing with pasta, roasted birds or grilled meat.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Andis 2012 Cooper Ranch Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A winning combination of seductive, spicy aromas and generous, well-developed fruit flavors make this wine hard to resist. It is full-bodied, dry and quite full-flavored, but without overdoing anything, so it's well balanced.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Naggiar 2012 Estate Grown, Produced and Bottled Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This tempting wine from one of Amador's biggest and oldest wineries has a great price and lots of big flavors. It smells like wild berries and light baking spices, tastes almost jammy, and has a classy dry balance. A very smooth texture wraps up all that goodness and makes it easy to enjoy.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Montevina 2013 Skyland Ridge Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Powerful fruit aromas and flavors send this full-bodied wine into the stratosphere of ripeness without interference from oak or too much acidity or any overtly tannic texture. It's all juicy and good in a high-octane style.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Renwood 2013 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is tight and well-structured, emphasizing a good, gripping texture and firm tannins while tasty berry flavors lurk beneath. It's not something to sip at a party, but a gutsy dinner wine to pour with osso buco or mushroom risotto.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Easton 2013 Monarch Mine Vineyard Barbera (Sierra Foothills)

Description: This handsome, full-bodied wine has aromas of dark cherry and toasted oak, flavors like ripe plums and vanilla and a velvety mouthfeel due to good acidity and fine-grained tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oak Farm 2013 Barbera (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Intricate aromas and spicy, complex flavors make this medium-bodied wine an adventure to drink. It smells like cherries and cloves and wood smoke, tastes nicely ripe but dry, and has an appetizing, tannic grip in the texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terra d'Oro 2013 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Red cherry, a touch of cinnamon, purple flowers and baked vanilla cookies show on the nose of this wine. Black cherry and gingerbread spice consume the palate, which also offers a rocky minerality and a vanilla foam finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hunt Cellars 2010 Starving Artist Destiny Vineyards Reserve Barbera (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Quite a lot of fruit flavor is packed into this straightforward, dry and non-oaky wine. It should be versatile at the dinner table because of its direct flavors, rather reserved texture and good balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Enotria 2011 Barbera (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fresh, bright aromas including raspberry and strawberry tag rich baking spices, and oak-induced maple syrup flavors for an appealing, jammy personality.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sobon Estate 2013 Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Earthy, leathery aromas and dense tobacco and cedar flavors make this wine a bit of a taste adventure. The mouthfeel is posh and finely tannic, and black cherry and dark chocolate notes kick in and last through the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Easton 2013 Cooper Ranch Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: This wine has strong aromas like wood smoke and grilled beef, then equally smoky, peppery flavors and a tart, rather tannic texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: McManis 2014 Jamie Lynn Vineyard Barbera (California)

Description: Aromas of blackberry, blueberry and baking spice lead the way on this roundly structured wine. On the chewy, concentrated palate, notes of white pepper and nutmeg add depth to the juicy black cherry core. Bright acidity and velvety tannins provide structure, freshness and finesse. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vigne Marina Coppi 2010 I Grop Barbera (Colli Tortonesi)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine offers aromas of coffee, mixed berries, spice, pencil eraser and herbs. The tart fruit flavors are generous and full, leading to cranberry flavors that carry on the finish. The oak seems primary but it still brings enjoyment.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Woodward Canyon 2013 Estate Barbera (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hot asphalt, condensed rose petals and black cherry show on the nose of this bottling from regional pioneer Ron Siletto's vineyard. A sip enlivens the mouth with expressive, tangy cranberry and iron notes, presented with a soft and easy acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bella Luna 2010 Lot One Barbera (San Benito County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of cranberry and berry are fresh and juicy. The flavors are tart and supple, showing depth and length. It's delicious in its own right but will shine on the dinner table.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Wind Rose 2012 Barbera (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bottlings of this variety and also this appellation are scarce in the state. This one has reserved aromas of red and blue fruit along with whiffs of spice. The plump, tangy flavors show a pleasing purity, trailing a bit toward the finish. Try it with pasta with a red sauce.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Wilridge 2013 Upland Vineyard Barbera (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Naches Heights, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The raspberry and cranberry aromas seem to show a touch of oxygen exposure. It's a pity, because the tart, lush flavors bring appeal.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Wilridge 2013 Estate Wilridge Vineyard Barbera (Naches Heights)

Description: Bold and delicious, this opens with earthy aromas of mature black-skinned fruit, truffle, scorched earth and a whiff of game. The savory, full-bodied palate doles out juicy black cherry, blackberry, licorice, and baking spice alongside bright acidity and refined tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina delle Rose 2012 Donna Elena  (Barbera d'Alba Superiore)

Description: Mature dark-skinned berry, leather, forest floor, eucalyptus and dark cooking spice aromas come together in the glass. The delicious palate doles out juicy black cherry, blackberry, white pepper, clove and licorice alongside round, chewy tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Brezza 2012  Barbera d'Alba Superiore

Description: Fresh, firm and fragrant, this offers aromas of ripe berry, blue flower, chopped herb and a whiff of dark cooking spice. The round, savory palate delivers juicy black cherry, raspberry, clove and anise backed up by fresh acidity and smooth, polished tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Adriano Marco & Vittorio 2012  Barbera d'Alba Superiore

Description: Bold and structured, this opens with aromas of spiced plum, French oak, menthol and a whiff of violet. The concentrated, full-bodied palate doles out blackberry jam, juicy black cherry, vanilla, licorice and exotic spice alongside fine-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Enzo Boglietti 2012 Roscaleto  (Barbera d'Alba)

Description: Fresh and refined, this delightful, easy-drinking wine opens with scents of rose, woodland berry and a whiff of dark cooking spice. The vibrant, savory palate offers juicy red cherry, raspberry and white pepper alongside bright acidity and polished tannins. Drink through 2018.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina delle Rose 2013  Barbera d'Alba

Description: Firm and full-bodied, this opens with aromas of mature plum, underbrush, baked earth, vanilla and exotic spice. The high-toned, chewy palate doles out ripe black cherry, raspberry jam, vanilla, mocha, white pepper and mint alongside polished tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Liuzzi 2012 Sil Nizza  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

Description: Aromas of mature black-skinned fruit, blue flower and Oriental spice float out of the glass. The round, full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, blackberry jam, licorice and pipe tobacco alongside chewy tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rivetto 2012 Zio Nando  (Barbera d'Alba)

Description: Aromas of mature dark-skinned fruit, scorched earth, exotic spice and a whiff of blue flower lead the way. The vibrant, savory palate doles out juicy black cherry, plum, ground pepper and anise set in a framework of racy acidity and softly polished tannins. Enjoy through 2018.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Elvio Cogno 2013 Bricco dei Merli  (Barbera d'Alba)

Description: Aromas of toast, espresso, ripe berry and menthol lead the nose. The round, savory palate doles out juicy black cherry, blackberry, clove, chopped herb and game alongside chewy tannins. A coffee note closes the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Palladino 2012 Bricco delle Olive  (Barbera d'Alba)

Description: This offer aromas of plum jam, Oriental spice, underbrush and a whiff of blue flower. The lively, approachable palate doles out juicy black cherry, blackberry, white pepper and clove alongside vibrant acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ascheri 2013 Fontanelle  (Barbera d'Alba)

Description: Mature berry, dark cooking spice and blue flower are some of the aromas that emerge on this firm red. On the palate, ground pepper, clove and licorice accent a black cherry core while brisk acidity provides the racy framework.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Comm. G. B. Burlotto 2013 Aves  (Barbera d'Alba)

Description: The nose isn't very expressive on this big, brawny wine but the chewy, full-bodied palate offers blackberry jam, raisin, licorice, chocolate and orange peel alongside smooth tannins. It still has enough fruit richness to carry off the hearty alcohol but drink sooner rather than later.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Falchetto 2011 La Rossa  (Barbera d'Alba Superiore)

Description: Dark and dense, this opens with aromas of ripe plum, vanilla and exotic spice. The round, chewy palate offers ripe black cherry, blackberry, roasted coffee bean, licorice and clove alongside close-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Matteo Correggia 2012 Marun  (Barbera d'Alba Superiore)

Description: Bright and fragrant, this opens with aromas of underbrush, rose, dark berry and a whiff of exotic spice. The savory, easy-drinking palate doles out black cherry, blackberry, white pepper and chopped herb alongside bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cascina Chicco 2014 Gramera Alta  (Barbera d'Alba)

Description: Aromas of scorched earth, mature black-skinned fruit, blue flower, toast and Oriental spice lead the way on this full-bodied wine. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, espresso, licorice and ground pepper set against a backdrop of fine-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Beni di Batasiolo 2011 Sovrana  (Barbera d'Alba)

Description: This opens with earthy aromas of scorched earth, overripe plum and a whiff of game. The straightforward palate offers juicy wild cherry, raspberry jam, coffee and vanilla alongside zesty acidity and fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2017.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Icardi 2012 Suri di Mu  (Barbera d'Alba)
